3uUUw7gBG0iORqPDMdx2LA.review_text: Don't get me wrong, I like this place but it looks like someone ordered a "Pub in a Box". If they manage to stay in business for a decade or so it will eventually acquire the authentic patina of grime it deserves.  I was on my way to another bar when I walked past this place, popped my head in and asked the bartender if they allowed dogs. While the bartender was telling me that dogs are OK I noticed David Allen Coe was playing on the jukebox. SCORE!  "Hey Katie, call Gwynnie and tell her there's been a change of plans. I'll be back with Matilda."  So now I have my best girl (Katie) and my best drinking buddy (Matilda) in a bar that plays twang bangin country music and waiting for some good friends to show up. What's that, they have Shiner Bock on tap? I haven't had a Shiner in about 20 years and now that I've got that out of my system I can wait another 20. Racer 5 on tap? Oh hell yeah!  When I settled up my tab it was an embarrassingly  small amount.  YOU HAVE NOT SEEN THE LAST OF ME!!!

FLwY5zLEIgmBr0H-n4eyoA.review_text: they have real aussie pies  winner

wr1Y8-yLVCoaDKR4ihiTGg.review_text: 8 bucks for a shot of JB and a tap beer? That's not good. You know why? Because for a chill 40 bucks, you've got 5 beers and 5 shots. If you can take that, you belong at AA, not McTeagues. The rustic interior has so much western influence that screams like a first generation Chinese born in Walnut Creek: Am I White or am I Chinese?! I'm so confused! But, it's more of a "Am I Irish or am I Texan?" It sort of feels like "I really don't belong in SF." Then you see the red lighting everywhere and it looks like a scene out of a vampire movie static.px.yelp.com/bphot… So what it is, McTeagues? Irish, PWT, and into dark magic? The bathrooms, however, are incredibly clean and the atmosphere is very chill. The dead celebrity/hippy coffin drawings on the ceiling are fun to stare at static.px.yelp.com/bphot… and the bartenders are good conversationalists. I love the solo pool table that hogs the spotlight in the rear. My verdict is to use this place like a brothel... It's good the moment but there's better elsewhere.

BcNJNvVk60cBJiuuNnwz8A.review_text: Cheap drinks with a very diverse crowd.  I came with some friends here on a Friday night and there was no cover.  There is definitely no shortage of guys here, but I guess thats pretty typical of the dive bar scene.  They have a bar up front as well as another bar at the back of the place.  The back bar is definitely less packed.  In the very back there are some hidden tables which is nice if you want to just chill with the people you came with.

4dZxgrVKVRJ9SUBODs9JjA.review_text: No, it's not in my neighborhood BUT, they've got anything you might possibly want to drink AND they will let you bring your food in as well as your dog.  The regulars are solid and the staff is dope.  Pool? Ball-game? Internet jukebox? Quentin Tarantino films?...They all exist here for your enjoyment.  For those trifled by the weekend madness, the weekday nights will satisfy your needs...so don't be shy.  Now, if I could just move it a little bit closer to my apartment, this place would be perfect.

GtQuA0QRg3NPWul5XF6b3w.review_text: This place is crawling with Texans and good vibes. It is kind of like Cheers mixed with Bay to Breakers.  If you are ready to "yee haw," then hop on down little soldier.  They've got a menu inspired by the SEC and the big 12 (Football) and my favorite an emphasis on bourbon, and 18 taps of west coast ales! Yeah!

gFB-b7IeNR3leLq8q-qeGQ.review_text: I first found out about McTeague's when one of the owners emailed me to reach out on behalf of the bar to offer to host an event for the Texas Exes, my alumni group.  I decided to check the bar out to see what it could offer, as our current game-watching location (Blue Light) was offering us nothing except a convenient place to watch our games.  Upon walking into McTeague's, I found a very spacious spot with comfortable surroundings.  The place is Irish & Texas-themed, as one owner is Irish and the other is Texan.  I got to chat with Chris (the Texan owner) and found out he wanted the bar to be a home for us Texas Exes.  The bar had a lot going for it: Texas decor in the back room, Shiner Bock and Shiner Black on tap, and 2 smokers to cook up some BBQ.  We decided to hold our Christmas party at the bar to test it out.  Chris cooked up BBQ for our group that was pretty tasty... and yes, it was really Texas-style BBQ, not that crap California-style stuff.  Everyone who attended liked the space, the food, and the drinks.  There was a decent crowd, but there was plenty of room to walk around and mingle, unlike in Blue Light where you get packed in like sardines and struggle to get a drink.  Overall, I love the spot and plan on having future Texas Exes events there.  It's also in a nice up-and-coming area on Lower Polk.  Chris is laid-back and really easy to work with.  I also hear they do free BBQ on college football game days.  Next year, they are planning on adding another couple of TVs during football season.  Thanks, McTeague's!

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Simply A-OK, I mean what is there really to say? It's a bar. A place to stand around, drink beer, play some pool, and talk to your friends. I would probably go back just because it seemed to have a nice laid back crowd for a Saturday night.

zXi8WzXV2lfefnnzPEnOOw.review_text: Me: "do you have the big ten channel on satellite?"   Them: " Yes dear and we have your vodka tonic and bathrobe waiting at the bar with your pipe"   Me: "Are you showing the Purdue game?"   Them: "Of course master and we have all of the Irish playmates that you pre selected in the ball cage lubed up with raspberry as per your instructions"   Me: " I asked for Brazilians   Them: "fixed, oh and the donkey did not agree with the price you quoted"   Me: "Oh well, at least tell me that JuJaun is starting center"   Them: "Leads the league in scoring he does sir"   Not sure where we are going with this but I wasn't wrong about the Dutch in the world cup and I promise you will see the Boilers in the final 8 at least.   I asked them if I could "Boiler up" and they conceded. Not many places that will do that for you.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: A staple to the Polk St bars, McT is just a downright old school place to grab cheap drinks and hang. they got a long bar that runs all the way down the place and booths where you can chill and talk. This place is like the neighborhood bar around the corner where everybody knows your name not named "Cheers".

JVL0eReGF-IPtiMypmuqSw.review_text: MASS PICK-POCKETING OCCURRED HERE LAST NIGHT  PROS - Minimal wait; can get in at midnight w/o question - No cover - Funny movies with subtitles playing - Well-drinks only $5 - Lots of young adults  CONS - Drinks are weak - Not good for dancing (lack of space and dance music) - No maximum occupancy enforced - 6+ other women & myself (relatively sober) had their iPhones stolen from their purses - No lost and found - Lack of desire by security to look into the pick-pocketing issue when asked  Note to security:  - Enforce max. occupancy  You described that theft happens "all of the time," at your establishment, and yet have not taken measures to help alleviate it on your end.- even an announcement to the bar warning others and letting the perps know they are not welcome would have been a start.

FkiDKAYGGNIPQVdMe4JEXQ.review_text: You may be asking yourself so why oh why did they need to open up another bar on Polk Street? Well there are many reasons but I can give you 2 good ones--a) Polk has the highest concentration of bars on a city street in San Francisco and it has to maintain its title and b) as a general observation (myself living in this area on and off over the last few years) I've noticed that Polkers--regardless of age, lifestyle choices, gender, income racket, you name it--seem to take a liking both alcohol and gatherings.Over opening weekend I saw many Polk regulars from all walks of life come into get a feel of the "new family member". Judging from everyone's reactions I can assume that it will be a welcome addition to the already active nightlife. The bar's namesake and itself is a nod to a character from Frank Norris' McTeague and to an era of San Francisco history almost forgotten (thrillist.com has more on the history of its origins both the novel and the building itself). Thoughtful decorations like the lamps, a wagon wheel on the ceiling, the high dark wood booths with thick lacquered tables and a long bar with plenty of libations quickly add to the gathering spot aura this place has already acquired. This place makes the most of its length and can definitely accommodate more than a few healthy sized clans. There is a pool table in the back (with some plush seating there as well) and apparently they plan on hosting music there at some point. For now there is a jukebox with a picture of Marilyn Monroe resting upon it. Staff members I met seemed in the custom Polk fashion of being cordial if not down right friendly.     The selection at the bar is a healthy one. I counted at least 20+ beer taps (with minimal repeats). Popular local favorites like Anchor Steam and Prohibition Ale were amongst those present and the LARGE display of liquor set along glass shelves, against stone brick work, led me to believe that they can cover more than just the basics. Someone mentioned something about a menu but I didn't see one. Regardless of that one quibble I can say that this place has a lot to offer. Go while it still has that new bar smell to it. 2 more quick things: they open at noon (earlier than most of the bars in the immediate area) and during the week Happy Hour is from 12-7. ($3 drafts,$3 wells seems to be special). Plus Friday afternoons around 4 or 5 have an extra bonus, free food. Last week's nibbles were smoked spicy chicken drumsticks and they were as big and good as you'd expect at a friend's BBQ. Yummy!

g8Omu6Bfutvw6dpbCZ5swQ.review_text: Not bad. Never really feel welcome in this bar. Maybe it's just me, but I don't know. Drinks aren't bad. I guess it's not my scene.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I'm not a big bar person anymore (yeah I'm getting old) but after hearing about McTeague's Saloon I was very curious to check it out.  I met with an old co-worker here last week and I really liked the place.  It was a much larger bar then I thought with a full bar, seating across from the bar at stand up tables and booths and a pool table in the back.  A good size crowd was out too.  Since McTeague's is close to my place and a very cool bar I will come back.

XgNTZh4HClQBODBLYohvXA.review_text: Super nice bar tenders at night and during the day. They're a soccer bar so they'll turn up the volume on important US games and I think they play EPL games even early in the morning. TVs line the wall behind the bar and there's TONS of seating.   This is also a great place to go at night if you're on Polk street. It does get really crowded but it's definitely worth it since there isn't any cover and the drinks are cheap/strong!  Bloody Mary's are hot, hot , hot! And they give you pickled green beans. Yes, please and thank you!   I love coming to McTeague's and I'm hoping the American Outlaws will make it their new chapter bar.

CKkwkxLeyA1M9MEXou5MqA.review_text: good: parking and lots of people on a friday night bad: my drink wasn't strong enough and the crowd didn't seem all that sociable overall, i would go again but make sure to ask them to make my drink STRONG. my long island tasted GOOD. it isn't supposed to taste good. it is supposed to taste strong and eff you up. i did not get effed up.

GIMg5oHqsJXdRq_7tR2jjQ.review_text: I'm still trying to figure out if this place is for real.  Country bar?  PWT bar?  Rock bar?  Saloon?  What's going on?  Hmmm.  It was dead on a Sunday night and I was very confused as to why there was someone checking ID's at the front door when NO ONE was there.    But the Bartender did make me a delicious filthy martini and give me as many olives as I wanted.  Also he hooked me and my friend up.  Two cocktails and the beer and shot special for $10.  He rocked! JITevzyEgskIJc6sgOyEgw.review_text: I liked McTeague's, it reminds me of Bacchus Kirk but lighter.  I recently went to watch some basketball and it wasn't a bad spot.  We left Ace's because Badger fans took over the joint and well red doesn't look good on me.  McTeague's wasn't too crowded, had a bunch of TV's and the booths are nice and intimate.  I was a bit confused about the roped off area in the back that said, "Private Party" yet there were only two people back there on the pool table.  Maybe everyone else hadn't shown up at that point.   I guess in theory it would be fun to have the pool table to yourselves but I also feel like it is 100% selfish.  I mean, this is a bar, how can you bogart the table like that.    Either way, for the area, I liked it.   I would probably go back.  It was clean, the decor was fun and the crowd was less D-Bag than some of the other venue's Friday night clientele.

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Well! It was nice to look up and see Kurt Cobain waving from his coffin on the ceiling. RbLr7NZwc9JZcMfBwhDNMQ.review_text: Love this place! My friend and I were on a search for a young crowd, but not too kiddish or creepy. Avergae pricing, and a lit up dance floor (very small) in the back.  The bouncer told us to go to the back bar past the dance floor to get drinks because it was way faster, and it definitely is. No wait time at all and friendly bartenders.  Multiple groups of guys come alone here, so of course the usual cheesy pick up line and ass grabbing is a given. Can be trashy groups at times, but overall crowded and a good time. Easy to get in, no wait or cover as well. I'd be back!

YKu33NNXHgghlqiWl3Z0Cw.review_text: Good ole' McTeague's. My bar-of-choice for the first stop (and sometimes last stop) of any Polk Street bar hop. I love the vibe this place has. Amidst a sea of flashier bars typically packed with the type of people that take themselves just a bit too seriously, McTeague's offers solace to thirsty twentysomethings who want nothing more than chill a atmosphere to kick back with friends and enjoy good beer at good prices. Plus, there is often plenty of seating, a lively, young crowd and cups and dice for your occasional drinking game. Overall, McTeague's is a great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night if you're looking for something fun and not too crazy.  The only -1? McTeague's gets very crowded at around 11:30 on weekends, so either come early or come prepared to feel a tad claustrophobic.

3JJnFGGUwDCgPw_eykqHBg.review_text: Good place to get rowdy with some seemingly authentic Irish folks.  Loud music and beer stained floors.  Not too many douches venture into this place so it makes for good group gatherings.  Quick bar service and friendly as well.  Good times always to be had here.

Qi_xP8C_2xo7MY4rmP_c3Q.review_text: Lots of tv's and they a pool table.

TgDNtUDKLPLEiyL0xQBPSw.review_text: Oh McTeagues, with your crap mash ups and poorly placed soap dispensers, I am rooting for you. You are one of the the last douche-free zones on Polk.  Your watered down Bushmills must be exactly what my parents used to enjoy after my high school self had at their liquor cabinet. Yay Karma!

ZMJOy-ECPnf6h__LJZdR_A.review_text: Guinness: $5  Walking into your friend's conversation about sandwich vaginas: priceless.

pLlwJOMcsH770F-H8rNJIA.review_text: This is a great bar.  Super spacious and prices are normal.  Went there on a Thursday night and it was happening.  Since it so large, it does not get too crowded.  Gonna try to catch a game here as well since many TV screens.

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: It pays to be a mellow, fun loving kind of chap at McTeague's. Why? The bartenders will remember you, treat you well, and they will be your best friends. Like best friends do, they are willing to back you up when the time comes.  By nature I'm a very relaxed guy. I like to watch football here for 6 hours and chat it up all Sunday long. A few weeks back though, I came as close to knocking out some teeth as I have in a very long time. A drunk, mouthy individual would not shut up. He just wouldn't, and he was directing his booze soaked ire to the left side of my face. For about 30 minutes.  The observant bartenders warned him. They told him he was pissing people off and needed to have a nice glass of shut the hell up. But would he listen? Nawwwwww, he was drunk. You know how that goes.  The bartenders who know me, know my demeanor, could smell something was wrong. The comments after the fact were that they'd never seen Justin like that before. I was ready to rip his head off. Perhaps me smacking his hand out of my vicinity and yelling point blank two inches from his face to shut the fuck up gave me away. I'm not positive.  Before I snapped and caught me an assault charge they 86ed him and sent his ass packing. That's good business right there, they recognized me as a regular and a fairly happy one at that. To evaluate and say hey, we know this guy and he's not like this. Something is amiss, we need to fix it. Well played, if it wasn't me that douche would have been pissing off another patron, I guarantee it.  I calmed down about 10 minutes after he bounced. We had a shot and laughed it off. I tried to buy but they were having none of it. I explained the sitch to maybe 10 bar goers who approached me and said "Dude... you were super pissed..... what did he do?" Luckily it went no further, McTeague's had my back and vicariously that means if you're a good customer who doesn't start shit, they'll back you up too.  I really appreciated that. Some bars will ignore and let the dust settle as it will. They treated me, a frequent visitor, with respect and remedied the situation before that asshole made me remedy it myself. I like McTeague's, and I like knowing that they care enough to take care of decent customers. I can honestly say I feel like they're my friends and I look forward to seeing their faces every time I roll through.   Much love Amber and Rick, much love. I'm sure Mr. asshole thanks you too, he got to keep his teeth.

p_BxcFMRCjtc3HbqlbT4Zg.review_text: Great place to watch Sunday football! They have plenty of drink specials, great prices and lots of seating. There are about 6 TVs above the bar and if the game you're looking for isn't on the bartenders are really nice about switching the channel for you.  The bloody mary that I got was pretty thick and had a ton of spices in it. Not the absolute best I've ever had (a little too heavy on the spice) but certainly not the worst. I'd give it a 3.5 out of 5 stars. One thing that  I cannot stand is a watery bloody mary and you will definitely not get that here!   I'm looking forward to coming back and trying McTeague's at night as opposed to Sunday at 10am!

z-R-_pNPK8FqHFSfC422SQ.review_text: I'm not sure what the theme is here. I saw cowboy boots along with some other random things. It's nice that this place is pretty big, so we were able to fit okay in the back close to the other booths.  The bartenders were okay for the most part, except for this one guy (wish I got his name) who took so long to get me just a cup of water! He walked in the back to check the kegs and came back before he could get me water! It really is quick, dude. The music was pretty good from what I remember and it's nice that they have plenty of security guards walking around. I hate the disco ball in the back because it kept blinding me in the face.

712x9G11ysEfwP1dCjgLNQ.review_text: Neat little Irish bar. I don't really know what it is about McTeague's, but I ALWAYS have a great time there. Been there for happy hours during the week, and it is not nearly as crowded as it is on the weekends but still have a fun vibe to it. It gets pretty packed on the weekends and turns into any other Polk street bar. Unless you find a table or a corner, you may find yourself being pushed around a bit on the weekends but hey - it's just like any other Polk street bar.

30Pch18LE63MyRYOC34-8g.review_text: What's a night of drinking on Polk St. without a stop at McTeague's for a pint of Guinness and a game of pool?  If you're looking for a laid back pub with tons of room, pool, and great beers on tap , then this is your spot. The bar here is huge, which makes getting a drink quick and easy.   When you need a change of pace from the hipster dive bars that line Polk head to  McTeague's for a little Irish hospitality.

58ZGUbmRpf8_lEHdE47upQ.review_text: I like it Southern Style sometimes, but any day is a Shiner Bock day.  That's right. On tap.  Getty-up N' Yee-haw.  After that, get your people watchin' eyes out and shake it a bit on the floor cuz this place is PRIME for both.

Did I mention the bouncers inside were so chill and nice too?! Omg I wish I these kind of bouncers were everywhere I went! Lol!

3gr0PN8aAHryd5dg1b3Qkw.review_text: Delish drafts! Had a blast with friends

The ladies there last night was very attractive, even the not so attractive ladies has personality for days, so in turn, made them attractive (did I cover my ass on that one?) Everyone there was handsome. I didn't have to get shit faced to enjoy myself. AND! A McCallan 12yr whiskey was $8.00! I think this has been the cheapest place I have had this... I spent $21.00 or so somewhere in the city for the same drink. I took 1 star away because the last whiskey i ordered wasn't whiskey at all, but vodka... but I guess it was ok since i was driving anyways. I Really enjoyed this place, and the company I was with.

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: For a dive bar, which I am not too big a fan of, I thought this place was pretty cool. They do NOT serve any food but you are more than welcome to bring food in. You can buy pitchers of beer and watch a game but they also have a seperate room so its not all about sports. I thought this place was pretty cool. Happy I went.

h3Yg3OE9uD6XEAPyEm3qEQ.review_text: Friendly bartenders. Great and roomy setup. Wide and quality draft beer selection including Batch 19 and Shiner Boch.  Lone Star State of Mind: If you're a Texan missing Texas music or just a fan of Texas music, this is your place. Big supporter of University of Texas sports - not a big deal for me, but good to know. $2 Lone Star.

cUnvmWGohwnZgZtltVmblA.review_text: How do I love thee, McTeague's? Let me count the ways:  1. The moment I walked through the door, an adorable handlebar-mustashioed bartender greeted me in a sincerely cheery way...YAY for cute boys greeting me cheerily;  2. I have no idea what that music was that was playing on the jukebox, but, DAMMIT, it was good...ALL of it;  3. The longer I sat there, the more I started to forget which decade I was in, which city I was in...it was like I was in Anytown, USA;  4. My Hornitos shots were filled to the BRIM...to the very BRIM; and  5. All around me there was interesting conversation upon which to eavesdrop.  I have a feeling I'll be darkening your doorstep again very soon, McTeague's.

wKIycKVbivn1AXp0rpZ8jg.review_text: $2 Shiner Blacks all day every day, or Chimay if I'm living life that day - yay!!!  And you just may get some free chili out front, or a chili buffet inside...you just never know...love the staff and the regulars at this place...

xqQJIa5hVBlxkSSETniKwQ.review_text: Had my Iphone stolen RIGHT OUT OF MY PURSE that was ON ME here. Although i've never had any other bad experiences here before...the crowd some nights can be a hit or miss.   Watch your wallets and bags...thieves are all up in this joint

NDH7N_TqW7uZPqLBuGTWqA.review_text: Beers are pretty cheap here.  $4 or $5 a pop?  It's very spacious inside.  And though this is an Irish bar, the gentlemen behind the counter all seemed quite Southern.  HOT!  But they're probably not.  :(

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: I saw people trying to play twister with the lights on the floor. Cus its big enough to play twister on the floor...  Cheap drinks. Bad decisions. Friendly bar staff. Good times.

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Plus another star for happy hour being from 12-7pm...  $3 mimosas and $3 Guiness? What????? Amazing.  -1 star for not having a back patio.  It does get pretty dark in there.

_PKZQRbzUqp9XciUVcKESw.review_text: Polk street bars rock, and I totally love McTeague's! Never have a bad time here! Friendly and fun atmosphere. Lot's of places to sit if you catch a table. Friendly bartenders. Great place to chill, drink, party, good crowd!

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: McTeague's makes me McHappy!   In one week's time I'll have completed my move to The Loin and will officially have inherited McTeague's Saloon as one of my local bars. I couldn't be happier. A far cry from the Bus Stop, this sports bar has large flat screen TV's, a long and spacious bar, and a pool table in the back for all you billiard players (or for people like me who like to play and just make fools out of themselves). The crowd is diverse and friendly.  I'm looking in to my Loin-like crystal ball and I see lot's of beer, sports and fun in my future!  P.S. Holler at me for #300!!! Woooot!

iHwqxEYgwk6G3aMwGsaQGQ.review_text: I am here so often I have to give this place 5 stars  Great location near tons of other bars this is my go to bar. Its a great place to meet new people or go with a group of friends.   Age range: 21 to 28 approx  Its a big place and gets real crowded which makes it fun. Not too hard to get a drink  Thursday to Saturday are the best nights here  No dancing.  Happy hour is also unbeatable

QMWlVYtOA6BVADnQu1niBw.review_text: It's in a great spot on Polk, the drinks are decently priced, there's no cover charge - but good goddamn is it crowded. If you try to go in any day except M-F, they'll have bouncers at the door and a line down the block. It's a college spot, so beware. Other than that, it's amazing! Very cozy and the regulars are friendly.

PG5KxVFUXbSrunYfJFHdsQ.review_text: So, I have a love hate relationship with McTeague's. On one hand I love them because I have been escorted out more than once and they still let me come back. Friday night was another one of those nights of drunken debauchery. On the other hand I hate this place because it makes me want to rage like I am still in college. I have no idea why I always end up at McTeague's when I am completely annihilated. But thanks for dealing with me shouting "I'm the Duke of San Francisco, I OWN THIS BITCH" this last Friday and I apologize to the bartender that dealt with me.   Fuck, I am 34 and still acting like this...  God I love San Francisco.

UwQxYK75s0wnS4A0ZYZ5tw.review_text: Curb Appeal made us walk in...5 hours later we left with a hand full of new friends and big smiles on our faces! The locals, service, pool table, and sports kept us there all day. Excellent Bar with great drink selection, good vibes and attentive Service (drink was never empty). We were exploring SF from LA, and my husband and I left McTeague's with a hand full of insider hot spots. It felt like we were with old friends when really they were new ones. Thanks Mike1 Mike2 and Mike's girlfriend for all your suggestions-we took them and had the best 5 days!

49aCB1D8ga70-57ZR7KhjA.review_text: McTeague's is always a sure bet when just wanting to meet up with friends and have a good time. Can't go wrong.

fvtKAImpVmginXpilSeEow.review_text: This place reminds me of the Kells in Seattle and that's probably why I liked it so much. Places like this on a Saturday night...you just have to be in the mood for. Anyway, we came here for our night our in San Francisco on my bachelorette party weekend.   We immediately scored one of the large seating areas by the front door. They had great beer on tap here and really good shots. It was also only a short cab ride from our hotel off of Market Street. I'd definitely come back here!

NMCFuswMza4K3DyhYSu6TQ.review_text: Had a pubcrawl here with friends for a charity.  They kicked me out because I had a money bucket in my hand.  I used to like this bar, but their managers are pricks and I will never give them another dollar.

7DHI26h1sNDwot13kXN3_w.review_text: Despite the fact that McTeague's has a bunch of nice flat screens, booths to chill in, and pretty cool bartenders, I still couldn't really get into it. Mainly because of the crowd. I partially think it was because I was in a shitty mood and came here after a long weekend, but then the other part of me thinks it's because I'm just reaching a point where I've been to a shit ton of bars like this and they're fast losing their cool factor to me. Either way I plan on going back and giving McTeague's a chance when I'm in a little bit better of a mood. For now though, three stars it is.

UzSOUmjvIS8FmCWRpLVhxw.review_text: Dudes.$12 for a red breast and s small pour at that! Live in the area....lots of bars....I'm just sayin'

aFz2L-VdKWanLUOPfDqvdg.review_text: I read some yelp reviews on this Saloon and decided to try it the other night.  We were out on the town with a few friends on a Saturday night.  We had a night cap at McTeague's Saloon.  The place was crowded but fun.  The bartender was very professional.  He did not skip a beat. He serviced us very well.  No complaints.  We had a good time.

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: Probably my most recent favorite bar to go to on Polk street, let alone all of SF.  Just a great long bar, with great drink specials and lots of different areas of seating, whether it be booths, bars, or tables.  Pool table in the back.  This place is awesome.

JMBxAWBRXzlq2xC4bYU1pA.review_text: The last time I was here I swore never to come in again- me & a friend stood right in front of two bartenders for over five minutes & were completely ignored while they chatted away- not helping customers, just chatting & ignoring us (maybe we didn't have the right vibe)  This time we went in & the Amazing Liz was behind the bar- she completely changed my opinion on McTeagues. Great service, she remembered my groups order through numerous re-orders, and I never saw her without a smile. If she's working, a definite 4-5 stars. Without Liz.... well, lets say that I only hope the other bartenders step up to the plate & become as good as her.

Q_8qAEFkzrzTVAJhLsxmBg.review_text: Pushy crowds, frat-tastic flirts, and angry drunken girls who threatened me in the bathroom because I apparently took too long. As in, tried to break in and hit me. It was difficult to have a normal, even civil, conversation. The highlight of my experience was getting a seat at the bar (which almost got hijacked by a lone middle aged man) with my friend, and chatting it up with the door guy while waiting for our other friends to enter.  This was an evening in the life of me when I ventured to McTeague's the other night. I've been here for St. Patrick's Day, random weeknights, and the busy Friday or Saturday... it's always seems busy, which is good. The bartenders are cool, but geez... I get panic attacks and can't stand being crowded. The crowd on said Friday night was particularly unruly, and as a rule of thumb, I dislike any small-ish bar with a line (and believe me, I wouldn't have come if it was this busy upon entering).

nrqbDl_0PZ1NUw81sJk8fA.review_text: What?!  A new place in Polk Gulch!  This place is a step up from the other standbys in the neighborhood.  It's nice to step into a new/clean establishment on this part of Polk.  What's good - for starters a full bar with over 10 quality beers on tap. I'm not a huge whiskey or bourbon fan but these guys have a lot to choose from.  Go for the house Pale Ale.     There is also a decent selection of  food (small plates) on the menu. Also the booths are nice as is the pool in the back.  The interior is a bit kitsch but then again so are a lot of the other places on Polk.

CHy-O9QjyH0uMkyuxjKp3A.review_text: Im rarely in the city but found myself there two nights ago. Had gone to some crappy bar that I felt horribly out of place, walked down the street to this lovely gem just to fit right in. Welcomed by the Johnny Cash music and a handlebar mustached bartender who makes me feel at home, I walked up to order a PBR. "Nope, PBR's too classy.. We do have LoneStar though." This is one of the reasons for my 5star rating. I visit Texas a few times a year, and have been looking for my beloved Lonestar since returning from my last visit.  All in all this place made me very happy, let me slip out of the city atmosphere, into an awesome saloon that I'll be returning to again. On top of Lonestar they have ShinerBock on tap served in rad mason jars. I also liked the paintings depicting legends who've passed (Janis Joplin, Cobain, Rick James!) as angels, and the big Texas Longhorns flag. I guess I could keep writing about everything I like.. because thats just it..I loved everything. Oh! And they have pool too. I know that I'll be coming here every time I find myself in San Fran.

z5HsCt_QKG04wuqkWiqzqg.review_text: My friends and I will never return!  Female bartender wasa witch.  Made an awful drink, which we politely asked to change for something else and she gave more attitude than I have ever seen.  Insecure girl thought she made the best drinks in town and said she is known for her drinks.  Told her it was nothing personal, just wasn't what we were expecting.  She was rude and went around to everyone talking about these rude people who didn't like her drink.  Managing bartender didn't seem to care that she was extremely rude and said it happened often and people mistook her "way as a Puerto Rican" for being rude.  I'm hispanic as well, so was a bit insulted.  She needs to realize she is in a SERVICE position and make customers happy rather than be a witch when someone expresses dislike for her amazing (amazingly awful) drinks.  Even the manager made an awful face when I explained how she made the drinks.  Will tell everyone I know to stay away from this place.  Awful.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I came to watch the Woman's soccer game and it was the perfect place to do it. Not crowded at all, great crowd, and great venue. Also nice that you can bring outside food in

WLRWL4WGhjK23lZWXKaTmw.review_text: Great place! I loved the friendly service, quality mixed drinks, and rock bottom happy hour prices. The "happy hour" is a bit of a misnomer, at McTeague's it's actually a happy 7 hours (12-7 i think), but who am I to complain?  Really cool bartenders and great Irish Car Bombs - how can you go wrong?

nNVymKSScJ-RTv4koFEfJg.review_text: Went on a Tuesday night around 8p, not crowded at all. Was told by the *extremely* inebriated and angry bartender that we weren't allowed to order any cocktails on the menu, that he's only doing beer and shots. He said if we wanted a cocktail, we should get out.  They have cocktails menus all over the bar, unclear why he wasn't willing to do it. There were maybe 6 people at the bar, and an additional 20 scattered throughout the rest of the pub. It was not that crowded, just incredibly uncalled for rude and poor service.

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: Hello bar! Yeah, alright. It's a saloon looking bar on Polk Street with average drinks at average prices. Sometimes there are sexy people here but not always. There are TVs for ports watching. There's a pool table in back for sporting. They serve food sometimes. There's a juke box  You can have fun here!

XmMsQHgj9MPCYhJ9MsJsdQ.review_text: So the first time I came in here, I wasn't quite sure what to make of an irish/texan bar with giant teeth hanging from the ceiling. I decided tho that for being 5 o clock on a bright sunny day, it was dark enough to feel right at home.  There was quite an eclectic mix of people which I always see as a good sign because usually that means its a bar that makes everyone feel comfortable, which it does. Ive been back since with friends to play pool at night and it was a consistently comfortable bar with good beers, friendly bartenders, sports and all the things required of a good local spot. Here's where I must rave about this place. The first day I came in famished from having not eaten all day. Scribbled on a piece of paper taped to the cash register was a sign saying "$5 chicken tacos". Then I see a man in the corner with a set up that looked like he brought everything from his kitchen. (Which now I would gladly welcome any day) I wasn't too sure this was going to turn out well cause I can be a bit of a food snob. Anyway best effin tacos ever! I've dreamt about theses things several nights since! The kind gentlemen even made ours after he had already quit for the day. So if you get a chance, they're a must!

qUPgcVR_WRJ8HhViLPyIWw.review_text: Hell Ya!   The place to catch League Soccer. Plenty of Tellies.

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: In spite of it's Irish name, this place really has nothing to do with an Irish bar. Other than the fact that people go here and get drunk.   The few times I've been in McTeague's I've had a great time. It's a pretty large space inside. Pool table provided in the rear. The first time I ever went here was actually part of a birthday pub crawl and the place held all 20 or whatever of us fine, we took over an area in the back, I had too many shots of fernet, it was great!   Really friendly bartenders, lots of folks that know each other around there. I'd comment on the drink prices but now that I think of it I've never paid for a drink in this place, I somehow always get someone to buy 'em for me here... Guess I should go more often!

WtZyXabdl1bP1XJ7vQRG-A.review_text: The drink selection is not great, but there's usually a good vibe here.  Lots of space to stand around and chat, and barrels to put your drinks on.  Came here for my birthday and they have this wicked colourful tile floor in the back that we ended up playing impromptu adult Twister on.  Good times!

9uGlVaTQOWQRY-A-X47xCg.review_text: This is a real old school sports bar for real sports fans. No (or at least not as many) poseurs here. Deceptively large with a lot of booths for you and your small group of cronies. Bouncers are nice and cool but do their job of keeping the peace and the waitresses here get it done -- they are able to keep it together in the largest of packed crowds and get you plenty to drink in record time (relative to other sports bars during a major event). Lots of staff to keep your tables clear of used glasses and trash. I like the oldish wood interiors and eclectic decor. And I love it that the bartender was able to make me a proper Manhattan with a brandied cherry that I ordered on a whim vs. the usual beer on tap.

ToRniGaDsM8D6S1jvlQcpw.review_text: Great bar for watching soccer (football) opens at 6am for EPL games and can't wait for the world cup next year. Michael is a great bar tender who makes awesome bloody marys and he's a nice bloke for a Chelsea fan.

70RE_TQRHWJNQkdaWnPgoA.review_text: I'm a big fan of this bar.  You can get a beer for 2$.  And it's a great place to watch NFL games on Sundays; nowhere near as crowded as all those bars up near Broadway.  Cool portraits on the ceilings too.

gcFwdhZfdhIacWQYbaLcBg.review_text: Based on the location I was not sure what to expect but I love the interior.  It was pretty quite when we were there but it is a nice place to watch sports. The jukebox was playing Johnny Cash and they have a lot of great beers on tap including Shiner Bok (which is hard to get outside of Texas). The  taps seemed to have an issue as some of the beers tasted funky (plasticy) but the bartender replaced them without question which was good service.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: My enjoyment of the bar scene has greatly diminished in the past year, either a sign of getting old, or that I'm usually just bored out of my mind. I'm done shouting above bad music and dealing with obnoxious drunks, and I'm not spending a lot of money on booze when I'm not big drinker. I fully admit a club is not much different, but at least I can dance.  So McTeague's was a nice find, as beers are cheap ($3 for a Miller Lite doesn't feel like a waste of money) and there is a massive jug of water available for patrons. No waiting for a bartender to get you a glass.  Music was still bad, but that's just my little world I live in.  Were I headed out for drinks in Nob Hill and had to recommend a place, this spot would be near the top of the list.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: I really was having the most excellent time here until a friend pointed out to me that out of the 14 of us in our group 5 of us, had glasses that were either cracked sideways, horizontally that is, or vertically, or had broken glass inside or outside of our drinks.  And no that is not a good thing.  So maybe McTeagues needs to invest in some need drinkwear.  Macy's is known to have great sales.  I got a whole bunch of good beer glasses on sale from my wedding!  Maybe it's time for them to stock up.  5/14 aren't good odds I would think.   Other than that I was having a blast.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Man, my head has been way up my ass to not stumble across this place until now. Really cool bar! Reminds me of any countless bars in the East Village/ 3rd Avenue in Manhattan. It wasn't very busy for a Friday, but I hear that Fridays in the city aren't what they used to be. Whatever.  Definitely coming back here during college football next year...

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: I've had mellow happy hours here (my favorite), I've had not-so-mellow raging good times here with dozens of new best friends, multiple shots, cocktails and pitchers of high quality beer...it's a cavernous space, great for large groups with strong drinks for cheap (my go-to drinks are almost always lighter in color than most places and it's definitely not due to extra ice), and it's also just a nice spot to chill after work.  It can get really crowded at times, but I've never felt claustrophobic when it is.    Entertaining decor on the ceiling, great music selection (whoever played the bluegrass version of "Gin and Juice" during a commercial in Game 1 of the World Series here, I salute you) and they even have food now - everytime I go here, I find something new to rave about.

t1rXXdLW3Rkw2QRNWjrLnQ.review_text: McTeagues eh?   Went there four times last week after work for a beer. They have plenty of TVs for sports, plenty of draft towers for beer, plenty of bottles on the bar to make stiff mixed drinks and a damn cool decorated interior.   McTeagues is a very comfortable watering hole during the day. I really enjoy this place and will most definitely be going back as often as I can.   What I didn't like was the ambient volume inside this place on a Friday night. Holy blown out ear drums, it was nuts. Maybe I'm just to old but I prefer McTeagues during the afternoon for a ball game and some beers.   Other than that, I recommend McTeagues to anyone.   Go Cubs!!!

XiVlH054UZ3A964ZIrBkPg.review_text: Pretty empty on a Saturday afternoon, even with it being the jumping off point for CrawlSF's Polk Village Bar Crawl. Unfortunately, the $20 card minimum is enough to sway an otherwise positive experience in a spacious bar with good looking guys*, tasty gin and tonics, and a big fan at the entrance that is overly conducive to drunk and windy Vogueing.   Waitaminute - $2 shots that taste like pink grapefruit gummy candies and are called pink tacos? I've never had lesbian tendencies before, but I certainly slurped a bunch of those down. YAY PINK TACOS!  *When I say it was empty, that's because it was. Those good-looking guys came with us, 'cause that's how we roll. My group of 15 wasn't just a part of the bar crawl, we WERE the bar crawl.

3ebQ_H8URQcynuhcePhc-w.review_text: Great spot. Lots of ice cold drafts, great church pews and solid barstaff. They always take care of you. Extra points for jukebox and $2 beer options.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: Many years ago, I fished a tattered paperback copy of Frank Norris' "McTeague" from a filthy bin at a used book store and couldn't put it down. It's a 19th century novel about the complacent misery of a Polk Street area dentist who hates his wife and loves his beer. Regardless of the literary tribute, I adore this pub for its mixed crowd and enveloping warmth, despite being such a cavernous space. Yes, I think Dr. McTeague himself would be happy to belly up to its beautiful bar for numerous pints to try and forget his troubles. And I'd definitely buy the first round.

G42xhGptP7jIofchHUmWDQ.review_text: What can I say this place is AWESOME......  Its a friendly local bar that draws 20-30's peeps.  Note:  the best night is hands down Friday night, since peeps come here to drink and mingle versus Saturday which is kind of pre-drinking spot before going to the final destination.  From what I've seen, people usually go here before going to Mayes (next door).   The crowd is really laid back and friendly, some people are dressed up and the rest are in jeans/tees.  They have 1 pool table in the back with several sets with various games on.  Ratios are usually pretty good here, like 50:50, very outgoing crowd, so if your anti-social and need a hardcore dive bar, then this isn't your place.  The crowd is a mix of ex-marina, North beachsters, and Russian Hill peeps... Major bonus since there arent any hipsters (sorry Mission peeps, but try Hemlock which is down the street).   Drinks are moderately priced.  Plus, a major bonus is that it doesnt take 10 hours to get 1 drink (ummmm like some places, I wont name, the hell with it, ex Mayes, lol).    Overall, cool place if your looking for a fun, mellow crowd, were you can meet new people and down some decent brew..

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: I'm sorry McTeague's. I know people LOVE you- but I just can't get myself to do so- at least not yet.  Came here after dinner with some friends as soon as the 49ers had clinched the playoffs. I really, really wanted to like McTeague's but the crowd totally turned me off.   Here's what McTeague's has going for it:  1) The price is right! For $16 we got two vodka soda's and a beer (maybe 2 beers- I didn't pay, so I'm not totally sure.)   2) I LOVE the layout! This place looks like it should be a ton of fun! The funky colored floor in the back is straight out of a Michael Jackson music video (though on a much, much smaller scale.)  3) Your bouncers are awesome. (Not as awesome as the bouncer at the Latin America Club- he's still my favorite) Totally friendly dudes.  Here's what scares me about McTeague's:  Now that I'm in the Tender-Nob, Lower-Nob, Whatever, the crowd is looking seedy. Fights are breaking out and I feel like a minnow surrounded by sharks. My friend and I started feeling a bit unsafe and left.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: I gave McTeague's a 3 but it could be better next time because I liked the place. The problem I had was the music was inaudible, mainly a thumping base and the bartender seemed new (slow and not talkative). There were lots of people which is always nice and lively and since the place was large and it was still pretty early it wasn't totally packed (which I liked). We tried the Nachos but I wouldn't do it again unless I was really hungry. I'm not a fan of the canned cheese sauce, the guacamole wasn't good but we did finish the plate so it wasn't all bad but we were very hungry.

rBJG010ohqwLY6PN6EO1Zg.review_text: Sad that I have to come all the way from Austin to San Francisco for line dancing, but McTeagues was worth the trip.  Added bonus: $2 longnecks.  Update: While I still like this place, after 3 visits I discovered my experience is unfortunately dependent upon when you go.  My last trip out was ruined by the a a scourge of vapid drunken college students.  One of them actually told me I "had to teach her" how to line dance and that "I was going to quickly" (said in the whiniest drunken tone possible).   I will be back, but I hope the night I choose has a more mature crowd!

6rzi5aFUa1HhRfhqkUUPBQ.review_text: I had a horrible experience at this bar. A friend and I stumbled into McTeagues on 11-17-11. We were enjoying our drinks and conversation when some guys came out of no where and started talking to us. We were polite but uninterested in their advances. At some point one of the guys drank my shot. As he started to walk away I asked him if he was going to pay for that and he finally left $5. My friend and I were completely shocked and of course we told the bartender and we asked him if he could replace the shot. Instead he got extremely angry with us and told us we had an attitude and that we had to leave. We tried to explain the situation several times and each time he refused to listen and walked away. It finally errupted into a full blown confrontation of me throwing my glass of water in his face, throwing my shot glass at him and knocking the glasses off the bar. I've never been so angry. All he needed to do was listen. I never use the race card, but if I were going to use it at any time this would be the time. He assumed that we were going to have an attitude and that we weren't going to tip so they didn't feel the need to give us proper custormer service. Worst bar experience of my life.

pZAktka6VfcXmUf4lWlBJQ.review_text: To preface, I lived in Austin, went to UT and therefore bleed burnt orange. And barring a horrific experience, I will support any establishment that does the same. That said, my love for McTeagues extends beyond the Longhorn camaraderie:   Pros - Shiner on draft, Shiner black (or blonde in the summer) and Lone Star--all of which are on special during football games - Super chill vibe most of the time...a great place to settle in, have a couple of drinks and catch a game - Bartenders are always nice; not always looking to chat you up, but timely in taking drink orders  - Solid BBQ and other food on Mondays and for special events  Cons - It can get a little nuts at night on the weekends...and it's a pain to stand in line.

cgDZVtYICeiK5t1rkesamg.review_text: Did Litquake choose this venue for its Goodreads Lit Quiz event for its name? McTeague is the title of a novel written by Frank Norris around 1899 about an eponymous dentist who opens a dental office on Polk St. in San Francisco.  I talked to one of the Litquake volunteers and he said the place wasn't chosen for its name but for its size.   This is a pretty sizable bar.  You wouldn't think so from the outside but it is inside. The main bar counter is long and there are booths and bar stools across from the bar. Plenty of seating for those who want to sit. Beyond the bar is another room in the back with a smaller bar, several more booths and more bar stools and big barrels as tables.   There are weird stuff on the wall as well as ceiling. There is a huge sign by the women's restroom warning people of phone thefts.  This place was crowded the night we came, as people were watching the Giants game. I can't speak about their cocktails because we just had beer here.  They have a lot of TVs, so it's a good place to watch sports. We saw people bring in food purchased outside the premises to have with their beer too. Not a bad place to get together with other Giants fans to watch the game and for nerds like us to compete in a literary quiz!

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: Stopped by McTeagues for football on Sunday. They had a bunch of TV's with a different game on each one. The place was not overly crowded, there was a seat for just about everyone in the bar.   To snack on we ordered the pulled pork nachos. They were really good, piled high with pork, cheese, salsa, sour cream, and fresh avocado. I would defiantly come back here for Sunday football.

8noSGkw6RBibmLEV92tRTQ.review_text: This place was great.  Was in San Fran and needed a place to watch the Longhorn football game.  They were friendly and had Shiner on draft.  Fun atmosphere during the football game and good beer.  What else do you need.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: This place is great!  I don't know how I always end up here every time I am on Polk, but there you go.  1) Drunken stupor.  We grabbed chairs around a barrel and ordered away. 2) Not-so-drunken stupor.  Had a drink and went on our merry way. 3) College football night.  It was surprisingly empty in there, so empty that I got a table.  Drinks were cheap, and the entertainment was fantastic!

Ldy03uMFaEEEnh3KIsPP_w.review_text: This place is great, I can't believe I have been to all the douchiest places on Polk yet never been to McTeague's before the last few months. The bartenders here are funny . . can't quite figure out how to describe them but I love them!  They're laid back and just. .I don't know, cool.  The 2 times I have been here I have left very drunk, and now I am sitting here hoping I left a tip, a good tip. . when I left last night.  Usually I leave too much cash when I'm drunk but the problem is I had no cash yesterday and I can't fathom that I was doing math very well adding up tips at 2am drunk ..  so . .shit!  Guess i have to go back there  .. just to make sure I tipped. ..maybe I should pre-tip in case I get all drunk there again.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: I was thirsty and this place seemed like a cool place to cut the dust.  It was.  The crowd was diverse, the drinks were reasonably priced and the bartender had a heavy pour.  The rock and roll decorations really make the place worth a visit.

Z8K8EDtI32hr7B-uNft-UQ.review_text: Great place and atmosphere. A little crowded on the Friday night that we went there but great place to meet people and the bartender there (the woman) was fantastic

EDyAbL7u6eLDm4sU7pBadA.review_text: I'd have to give this place different levels of stars for going at different times. I've been to McTeague's at night on the weekend, and I wasn't really feeling it. It was really packed, and it was hard to get a drink quickly.  However, I've been there for happy hour on Friday, which had free nachos (!) and my friend and I easily found a place to sit and relax. Then it's a really laid back bar, with a good choice of beer, and a good option for hanging out and talking with your friends, especially because they have booths. I've also been there at 8:30 on a random Monday night, and even though it was almost empty, but to me, it's more enjoyable during the off-peak hours, because you really get to enjoy the atmosphere of the bar, and see then I start to understand why it's called McTeague (after the book) because of the nice wood decor and saloon vibe.   Overall, I'll go back, but mostly because I live right nearby, and not on a Saturday night -- then maybe I'll head down the block to one of the other hundreds of bars nearby.

kKy2XrlFbQxtbukkFYMiPA.review_text: Great cheap drinks. I like blacking out here because I always wake up in a bed that's not in jail, and I always still have my wallet, phone, and keys *knock on wood*.

bFhO6S3Cuj-VitKG2PLsGw.review_text: This is one hot spot to visit if you are bar hopping on Polk St.  Drinks are cheap, strong and it's always super packed on Thursday or Friday nights!  The bartenders here are nice and super generous, so tip them well!   We never have a boring time when we visit McTeague's!

WPJhoQF8O2pFoiJXbMdYLw.review_text: Solid choice, especially if you enjoy beer.  They've got a pretty good selection of beers on tap, which during happy hours and Monday/Thursday Night Football were $3, and even when it isn't a special it is still reasonably priced.  McTeague's is a good place to go if you're with a group of friends, or if you just want to watch the game.

qlWy5_LVTtv7AtWb9ZzwHQ.review_text: After having a couple glasses of wine at S.N.O.B. we went a few doors down to McTeague's Saloon which was pretty much empty. It was a Sunday night, so it was expected. We went straight to the bar ordered a beer and then back to the pool table and played a couple rounds with our roommates (quarters needed) . If it's possible to take over the back little section with a group of your friends I would say, that is the best way to get the full advantage of the bar. We will have to venture back on another night when I'm sure it will have a bunch more people. sanfrancisconoobs.com/07…

N7oEZOfCUgewySEIfMwLEg.review_text: Happy Hour from noon  to 7...check Booths that make you feel classy and at the same time give you an opportunity to not have to hang out at the bar...check Pool table...check Classic country blaring on the jukebox...check Did I mention the happy hour from noon to 7? Because that's pretty awesome.

JM9JKzwz_b-S_YTLehO_SQ.review_text: The best place to watch soccer in San Francisco, period.  I have been to many pubs in North Beach, the Sunset, and Richmond, but this place is the best.  There is always a crowd even at 7am.  Beers are cheap, plenty of TVs, and Michael the bartender is awesome (despite him being a Chelsea fan....).  No other place to watch soccer in the city.

rK8kLDiaKoIexHy3JzcVCA.review_text: Have you ever wanted to listen to country music while sitting in an Irish pub?  I didn't know that I wanted to either, but it turns out that it was just what the doctor ordered!   In my neverending quest to find the interwebs in places that I can sit in without having a major freakout, I came across McTeague's.  That's right, a bar with interwebs!  Joy.  Plus, the owner (I think) even made sure I sat somewhere where I could keep my computer plugged in.  Shcore.  And the Irish/Texan mishmash is almost just right.  I personally have ZERO problem hearing some Morrissey right after Johnny Cash.  It's the kind of warm misery that works perfectly for a rainy afternoon when you're contemplating the future and could probably use a good cry.  Oh, and it looks like they have fun televised game days where you can revel with others who like the watch the ball go far!  And eat free food, of course.

LbhaNZPw8kIy1mbm6ORAhg.review_text: Solid place to go for the USMNT soccer games. Great crowd and Jesus (the cook) makes amazing food! The bartenders are cool people and you can tell they enjoy working the games since they ring the bell every time the US scores. $2 lone star longnecks and the feel of the south within the establishment makes it a good place to bring friends.

mbZeZOnmi4uSanwqkghb6Q.review_text: I don't like being deceived.  The website states that happy hour drink prices are $3 for well and draft drinks.  I went there for happy hour last night and ordered a vodka and 7up and it was 4 bucks.  Popov and that bar do not deserve my four bucks.  Oh, and the atmosphere is shitty with blaring tvs and horrible lighting, even though the tables are nice and woody.  Lamelamelamelameliarslamelamelame.

it5gxx2TAC220gDvGLR_eQ.review_text: They do last call at 1:15.  They very aggressively kick everyone out at 1:30.  Short-stack steroid-Mohawk boy yells at everyone at 1:31.  So if that's your bag, go here.  Otherwise, go to Mayes next door where the bartenders and staff don't suck.

Mv2986Y7NVnvTLkT1nLgCw.review_text: Unpretentious and clean - somehow a hard combo for a not-fancy bar to hit!  I actually wandered in here the day after a Giants game, and the place was clean and the staff was right on it. Add to that the fact that they still had a sense of humor, and I immediately added McTeague's to my 'safe places to land' list.   Also - nice bar, TVs have not TAKEN OVER through enormous size and oppressive VOLUME, and the barkeep was actually playing the jukebox every time commercials came on. Nice touches that make it possible to hang out...

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: Came here for Halloween so can't speak to its usual action.  Spacious and didn't have funny smells, good enough for me.  It seems popular with the residents.  I only came here once when I was a resident.

m1YPLRS5Lepqi_cWXEPXFw.review_text: Unique interior that speaks the word "fun"! Although it looks small from the outside, this place is fairly big and is a great place for a group gathering. The last time I was at the bar was on a Friday night after work (around 8pm), and there was hardly anyone inside. Perhaps too early?

q_QQ5kBBwlCcbL1s4NVK3g.review_text: Some dead celebrities on the ceiling, some complimentary BBQ ribs on the collapsable table near the door, and Shiner Bock on special 24/7. That is what makes McTeague's a righteous saloon.   While it's mostly a destination for catching a football game, I actually respect it as a bar beyond just sports. The booths in the back are cozy and the bartenders ain't nosy. Throw on some NFL action and everyone is high fiving and smiling away.   I'd take an hour or so here any day.

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: McTeague's is a downright fun bar and I'm surprised I don't come here more.  Planted on Polk, it rounds out the line of watering holes pretty well on this street. Casual, easy going and basic, but it still has it's own unique feel.  It's a wide space, with a weathered floor and long wood bar that has seen its fair share of tipsy. Those who man the bar are on point as well. It was packed on Friday night as we came to celebrate a friend's Birthday, but we never waited more than a few minutes before we were attended to.  The crowd really makes this place. Down to earth, beer drinking folk, all looking to find the laughs of the night, and find the route that will at some point lead them to a basket of fries at Grubstake.  Drinks are cheap and you don't need to don the designer threads to mingle.  Good times. Very Good Times.

3E_FEKfMfP4BnQNu7UmCVg.review_text: McTeague's is a great place to grab a high ball after work.   I like the classic interior. A nice sturdy wood bar, pool table, plenty of comfortable space. It's a great place to go with friends. If you're alone or in the mood for mingling it's good for that too. The crowd is usually a good mix of ages and types so, whoever you are, you will likely strike up a conversation with someone cool.   I drink cocktails with club soda and I've been poured countless flat drinks, but I've never gotten a flat drink here, so the drinks are great too.   Cheers McTeague's!

De8tuYPKZwpT-syR1sylOQ.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and enjoy stopping in during the week, or on the occasional weekend afternoon to watch baseball and eat a burger from Sliders on the corner.  The bartenders are always cool and there's enough televisions to catch any important game that might be going on.  Even had a good time gambling on the national spelling bee one evening!  Good prices on their beer during happy hour.

JbV35FSTr4p1UG_9vnrUYw.review_text: Divey yet generally solid Irish / Texas bar on lower Polk in Tendernob.  Can become too much of a mob scene for me at times on weekends, but overall respectable joint.  The good: 1- cheap drinks 2- around a lot of other places (good location for barhopping / pub crawl) 3- shiner bock 4- has an "Alex Smith #11 Sucks" sign up at the bar 5- closest thing in the bay area to Texas for Longhorn football watching 6- near my house (file under: things of great importance to you)  The bad:  7- can develop a slightly bro-on-the-prowl creeper vibe on weekend nights (Marina lite, I'll call it...) 8- despite being a decently big place, it fills up (I guess this is both a pro and a con) and can get super crowded, almost overwhelmingly so 9- like most places on Polk, McTeagues has like a 5:1 guy:girl ratio.  While you'd think this would be a plus for me, please see #7 above. 10- $15 bar tab minimum, which at the McTeagues prices, you may or may not be able to meet

A7yS4WVvWbT8_OqPR6gNIQ.review_text: DISGUSTING, ABUSIVE & UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF!  I live down the street on Polk and decided to check this place out on a Friday night with some friends. When we got there there, was a small line but we got to the front in  a minute or two, and were looking forward to a fun night at a local bar. That was until I was confronted by the most rude, unprofessional, and disgusting bouncer I've encountered in my life.   The bouncer asked me for my ID, glanced at it for a second, and proceeded to tell me it was fake - mind you I'm 25. I legitimately thought he was joking with me so I said "you're joking right".. for some reason, that one really ticked him off. He came right up to my face (to the point where I could smell the alcohol on his breath, which is an entirely different problem), and told me to get the F*** out of his doorway.   When I told him to take another look because I'm 25 and my ID is real, he grabbed me by the arm, threw me to the ground and told me he was going to step on me if I didn't leave the premises!  I don't care if this guys job is to bounce the door -  he has absolutely no right to physically throw a girl on the floor!  Neither I nor my friends are EVER going back to McTeague's saloon... no one else should either until they:  1. Teach their bouncers how to do their job and properly read ID's 2. Understand that it's against the law to have their bouncers drinking on the job 3. Fire the disgusting bouncer who thinks it's ok to physically abuse a potential patron for no reason  There are plenty of other great bars on polk with respectful staff, and really anything is better than McTeague's Saloon

9kh_53sFaYURr_Wu6cmY1w.review_text: Best nostalgic juke box, every song made me feel like a teenager good beer selection, but i was doing booze, nice, stiff and cheap and the bartender was super friendly and kept coming around, didn't once have to catch his attention, he was on it. and then when i thought this place couldn't get any better i looked up...

Fj5cMqRxXpfNo-4JVjDfeQ.review_text: This is my favorite bar in the Polk/Bush area.  The new booths in the back are awesome and there is always a good crowd.  Get there early or you'll be waiting in a long line.

qluQa4MUao9gaoOpcqbGSQ.review_text: I always go to this place and I've never EVER had an issue to where I thought, "maybe I shouldn't come here anymore."  The folks who frequent it are nice and seem no-nonsense since my favorite bartender Amber kicked out one very drunk and rude doucher who flipped me off (granted I was giving him the dirty eye because I had encountered him earlier in the evening and watched him run out on his tab).  Their happy hour is fantastic...so good and I love the saloon feel.  Go here if you want to chill and have a drink that's not going to cost you an hour's pay, but don't go here and be a douche because no one in the joint's going to tolerate that.

1eOf0y_ndQPaQVcE2v6tDA.review_text: I knew I was going to like this place. I took a class at SF State called History of San Francisco, and we had to read the book, "McTeague". I fell in love with the book and when I walked past this bar I thought "I MUST GO HERE!!!!  It's a lot bigger inside that I thought. Plenty of seating is always good! There was also an electronic juke box which made me a happy girl. They don't really specialize in fancy cocktails, so don't try to order one. My dumb ass asked the bar tender to make me something creative with vodka and she said "Um, we're pretty much a beer and whiskey kind of bar." And my boyfriend made the "haha, my girlfriend is kind of a ding bat" laugh. Oopsie. The bartender was a good sport and made me a cocktail that was pretty good.   For our second round, our bartender was this dude with a voice like Macho Man Randy Savage. He was freakin awesome. I asked him if he had read the book, "McTeague," and he said he tried but someone stole the book from the bar. I plan on going back and giving him a copy. Anyways, he made me a strong drink and I liked him. He was nice, even though he looked like he could kick my ass.  So yeah, McTeague's was cool. I would probably go here with my beer drinking friends and not my vodka drinking friends though.

JVtiosEPHgld2kc1BnDT1w.review_text: Just came in and loving it. It is 4pm on a Thursday, I am working thanks to free Wifi surrounded by great music, lovely environment, and lovely bartenders:)

Zcg8WQHGP8kLAIMfbvfgUA.review_text: The bar itself is really nice and chill. It's a great place for Happy Hour and a great place to watch games. I also think their drink prices are reasonable when compared to other bars. The only problem I had with the bar is the music. They played some of the worst music I ever heard at a bar. Maybe I picked a wrong night but for me to change my mind on the ratings, the music needs to start getting a little better.

Gr17h3JDn7wWQo40kJKaGQ.review_text: Met a bunch of German dudes in my stay in SF last weekend, and decided to party it up with them.   This was the first place on our stop, and it was crazy crowded. Also, total sausage fest, so yeah...  Anyways, the drinks weren't too expensive, especially for SF standards. I think it was like $5-6 for beer, and $7 for shots.  In an attempt to represent our country, I accepted my German brethren's' challenge in drinking, and downed shot after shot of Jägermeister, all for America.   I came out on top at the end, but my liver definitely did not.   Great place to start off the night, but at a 9-to-1 guy girl ratio, it won't be your ending spot.

iqOaVJRprVKcT50t9k5jnA.review_text: Dark, spacious, Irish, Texan, beer, pool, booths, fun.

3X8nPqq5b-VItOiWdn73jw.review_text: McTeagues, my long lost friend I've been looking for and now always around. You appear with open arms and "nothing to hide, believing what I say".   A place that can not only quench my thirst, but could have saved Mac himself in Death Valley. Great space with plenty of room and a few nooks, not some hole where you are continuously bumping into everyone. I dig the style here and appreciate the change from norm - $2 Busch and not the same'ol cheap beer option in Pabst. Solid location with places all around to get some grub at half time - yes, they have the NFL ticket not just broadcast! And everyone I've met that works there has been pretty cool, so I'll keep coming back for sure.

EsICEpy7Yek7zlDLgGWv8A.review_text: $2 Lone Stars and great staff - enough said

vGmCzwBI6MMQ0CTDl1o86A.review_text: Open on Christmas Day kind of a mixed crowd, overall not bad. Even thooo it's in the TL!

PLXuHH8owd8jMGhB4uqjcA.review_text: I love this bar.  Seriously, love at first sight, or first drink maybe.  This place is clean, there are two bathrooms for women, the juke box music is solid, AND the drinks are cheap.  I still prefer Bigfoot Bar, but I'm sure you'll see me again at McTeagues, especially because drinks are only $4 post happy hour...and I am cheap...

7CJBasUIoN6Ioo99dl_kqA.review_text: Thursdays is country night line dancing lessions they say they start at 7pm its more like 8.30pm not great teaching it lasts for less than 10 minutes,hard to follow its a fun night ,spontenous line dancing breaks out every 20 minutes after teacher is gone,who knows what steps people are doing, its at the back bar beer specials 2-3 beers $2 see the sign outside the bar,bar staff at front a bit slow  friendly bar man at back,quick service, watch a few youtube videos before you go,so you will be an expert line dancer  they had hot dogs $3 fun Thursday night,lone star beer $2,chumba beer not in stock,and dos equis$2 ment to have $1 tachos but not in stock, look for coffin on ceiling,in front bar lots of tv screens in front bar

xJ7qQYYdeeegz0lKS2rP-g.review_text: So, this guy looks like every over-the-hill jock villain from every 80's movie. The lil' curly "man bang" he's using to try and cover his receding hairline is bobbing up & down as he does the robot while he's mocking my friend, and it hits me...this is a pretty shitty place to grab a drink.  I've been to this bar a few times, mostly during the last World Cup, and it was ok. I didn't think it was anything to write home about. The drinks sucked, and the beers were way too overpriced. Now, during the night time setting, just jam like God knows how many, yuppies, douches, and jobbers into that same lack-luster bar setting, and what you have is what we affectionately refer to back East as a "Hot Mess".  I don't require much from a bar. And yes, there were more than a few pretty girls there, but good luck trying to holla at them. It's was too jam-packed to even get to the bar, let alone stalk some pray. No sir, these are not the hunting grounds you're looking for.   I don't know what my friends thought of the joint. They were three sheets to the wind, with their beer goggles strapped on tight. I'll be surprised if they remember even being there. I know that bars in SF tend to be a touch crowded and overpriced, but honestly, you can do a lot better that McTeague's. xD

jRjx9Xjvgj3PaPmaOYGWAQ.review_text: Lots of white caps and blond hair, screaming Journey and Mellencamp songs while pointing at the ceiling and each other. It's not a bad thing, it's just not my thing.   In a way it's nice to have this to counterbalance the hipsters taking over the TL.

4YbVs7kKXflxMjTyl9sd1w.review_text: My friend had her iphone stolen there. The security did absolutely NOTHING to help out even though we pointed out the theft. By the time they reacted the thief had reached the streets and the security said they can no longer do anything. The management should do something about this. Ridiculous!!!

cl6QnZD4W_sPqeDExoMruA.review_text: Salute to McTeague for the best time (to drink) and for the worst time (to get kicked out).  This is my usual hangout bar after work. You can't complain about this place at all - a pool table, tv's, BEERS and LIQUORS. Of course the fun hangout moments. Good times.

W_MuoJIhSJYCXJ3q6TkyWA.review_text: Probably the only reason we'll come here on a weekend is because there is not a line.  You usually don't have to wait to get into McTeague's and there is no cover.  Once you get inside, it could be pretty crowded.  If you get there early enough, there are booths in the front and also in the back.   There are 2 bars, one as you enter and another smaller one in the back.  The bartenders are nice and quick.  The drinks are average.  The one drawback about this place is that it is known for theft.  There have been so many times when I've come that someone has gotten their phone stolen.  Probably not worth the risk to come here if you are a girl.

KRcarrlaABmgM-EzofCh_g.review_text: I came here for Halloween festivities and I was sober. This was obviously a mistake but it was during my 3month detox! I couldn't help it!  Luckily, we were able to snag the little nook right next to the door and front window. It was sooo crowded and gross inside. Granted, it was probably because of the holiday, but it wasn't pleasant in any way. Also, the bathrooms are so tiny. There were only 2 stalls and clearly they get a lot of guests! This was not ok!  I've been to some other places on Polk St, so I don't think I prefer McTeague's at all.. bleh

Q0ykiwzKxzV3y1fx6HxlXg.review_text: This place is really cool, fast drinks, friendly bartenders, lots of TVs and places to sit.  The fellow drinkers are affable and into sports as well.  I think they serve food here also but they didn't mind when I brought my own sandwich in and ate it at one of their barrels (lol, they have barrels set up as tables to add table space without taking up a lot of room).  This is a very comfortable bar with lots of good people to drink with and watch games at.  I'd bring my mom here.

ygn1QWGOyJPbfDo5Nekk9Q.review_text: A cute, cozy local (for me) pub that you can casually walk into and expect to find a seat or table for yourself. The bartender is very generous. She was very generous with my scotch.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: I must've put in $2937492374923 into the juke box and it never played my damn songs.    I've been here twice, nothing totally stands out.  The front door guys are always super nice and friendly when checking my ID.  I don't know how much drinks are here because I've yet to pay for them on my own.  Last night (Saturday) a bunch of meat heads and douche bags were there.... but they were all generally pretty friendly.  It's a pretty decent sized space but can get super crowded (St. Patty's Day).

rUktcQgb1_fnBjwdsbKjHw.review_text: If you want to be treated like you're in Vegas, come to this shithole. And by that, I don't mean treated like a high roller, I mean treated like a talking wallet.   If you want to hang out in a crowded hallway filled with people, go to McTeagues.   If you want to have the lights turned on at 1:20, this is your spot. I was moved from one end of the bar to the other a HALF AN HOUR before last call. All I wanted to do was finish the beer that I paid for, wasn't making a fuss, wasn't beligerent. It was me and my girlfriend in a booth finishing our very full drinks. Some dickhead tells us to put our drinks down and leave. I look at my watch and he says,"don't look at your watch, get movin'."   I've been here a few times and every time has been mediocre. The place has no vibe, good or bad, looks like shit and is too crowded.  Oh, did I mention that they charged a cover and then pushed everyone out 10 minutes later? What a fucking scam.   Mediocre everything, over priced. Honestly, they've fooled me enough times.

6-gsL-2A5j-Pjm7LxsRxhw.review_text: I went here last week before heading to a concert to grab a round of drinks.  I've been here before a couple times and service was fine, but my latest experience really pissed me off.  I ordered a simple well drink. The bar tender told me the price ($7) and then I handed him my credit card. He told me the minimum was $15. I told him, I understand, but I would like to open a tab and in case I do not go over the minimum, I will pay cash. He took my card, whispered something to his fellow bar tender and then began helping other patrons.  After finishing the drink, I was trying to order a 2nd. The same bar tender was directly in front of me and I asked him for another. He appeared to nod his head as if he acknowledged the order but then walked off. I gave him the benefit of the doubt and assumed he didn't see/hear me. The other bar tender was walking around on my side of the bar and taking orders. She took orders of everyone around me first, then stopped at me, asked me what I wanted, then walked away to the other side of the bar. This time, I knew I ordered a drink and was being ignored. Please keep in mind that the place was NOT crowded.   Finally, the original bar tender was back and it took me at least 4-5 attempts to get his attention, after he again helped everyone else around me. Finally, I said that I want to close out and that I will pay cash. When closing out, I asked him for an additional drink and asked for the total. He then said that the total was $15. I told him that I disagreed with the price change but he wouldn't budge. So, I told him, "Thank You, I don't want the drink anymore", paid cash for the 1st drink, took my CC and then immediately left the establishment.   Additionally, I do not know if it had any influence on how I was treated, but I was the only colored person (along with my gf). I can't help but feel that I was discriminated against since everyone around me was being helped.  Today, I found out that he swiped my card and charged me amount for the drink even though I paid cash that night. I never signed anything or authorized the transaction. I called the bank and they are issuing me a refund. However, the bartender took my cash and the CC transaction still gets counted toward their books. The bartender prob pocketed the cash, giving him a $7 tip for being a terrible bar tender.  Takeaways: 1.  Very poor service/pay little attention to customers 2.  No consistency in pricing. 3.  Use a credit card in case you have to deal with this BS. 4.
