Judging from my experience and some of the other reviews that I read here, they do not welcome diversity.

HSZyANaM7KSyV7W_d1aoIg.review_text: Great new place. Lots of good tap beer, nice to see shiner bock on the bill. Nice whiskey choices. Beer was 4$ a pint sunday night, lets see if the price goes up. Pool table for 1$ juke box. I liked the decor old red wood ,lots of room, big wood booths for social gatherings. Friendly bartender. One guy at the bar even bought a round for everyone . Very cool! Also named after one of my favorite books of fiction called "Mcteague" by Frank Norris a must read if you live or hang in the hood.

uEyrkvXJ3CMb3WS4C_F_lA.review_text: Too expensive to be a dive bar, but not too pricey, with a dark lighting feel.  Plenty of specialty drinks.  I will definitely come back here.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Oh, you got problems?  There's a group called EVERYBODY and they all meet at the bar.   Problems solved.  Especially on Thursday nights when it's $2 longnecks, $5 American Born moonshine and a lot of down home country folks rockin their boots on the dance floor.   If country music ain't your thang, there's plenty of TV's to catch soccer and/or football games here too!

4JJcs7IIpn_Mu0rJz1_pyQ.review_text: This is a pretty good place to come for some low priced brew or well drinks. Definitely a place to start off the night since it is low priced. The crowd there is mixed and can sometimes be too loud to talk in. I dont go to concerts to yell, so I dont dig bars where I have to do the same thing...start the night a little early, get your drinking done here!

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: On what was supposed to be a chill Thursday evening, McTeagues became one of my many stops along Polk street where I proceeded to take back shots and drink a few vodka gimlets. Definitely not a super hip bar, but one where you grab drinks with friends and chat it up. Bartenders were attentive, drinks not too pricey.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: A nice, chill bar on Polk and usually standing room only -- a good place to grab a few beers but on a Friday night was tough to hear my friends -- so, not the best spot if you want to have a pretty consistent conversation.  Otherwise, the feel of the place is pretty good, and although it was crowded, it still didn't feel thaaaaat crowded.  A-ok.

NhcHLDJDqyC621vZ834PKA.review_text: It's a good sports bar with lots of HDTVs. Too many dudes, though. It's big, but it's mostly open floor space (and not a dance floor). There's a second bar and some booths in the back, which is nice, but there's no smoking room.  5:1 Guy:Girl Ratio + Lack of smoking room (I'm gross, I know) = -1 star. Other than that, a great place.

W3yt9vnoRcOPNXZ6XksVsw.review_text: Really my favorite bar in SF...When I first moved to SF three years ago this was my spot since I lived in Nob Hill--Great for watching sporting events, late night drinking...everything.  Why did I wait this long to write this review? Well because last night I went again and remembered why it is my favorite bar. First, I asked them to change one of the tv's to a volleyball game I wanted to and they did right away without giving me a hard time.  Then, it was my friends birthday and they made sure to help us order a specialty shot for her to enjoy.  We were there earlier (7-9) and it was easy for us to enjoy be around the tv and for us to enjoy watching the game.  Although late night (10:30-11PM) the place will start to get really crowded and is not really my scene (I enjoy chill places where you can sit and enjoy beer and whisky). Overall this is a great place to be anytime during the day/for watching a game. Or if you want a fun packed night.

UYzswwIokGnyc6IoyjuoLA.review_text: Came here after a work event with a friend and must admit the service sucked.  One of the waitresses was taking shots with customers a table over from me, while our actual waitress was nowhere to be seen (probably Miley Cyrus twerking in the back).   After fifteen minutes of waiting I decided to order drinks from the bar.  Let's not forget the fact that it wasn't busy! The cool waitress who rips shots with customers didn't even ask us if we were being waited on--not a shocker.  When I asked the bartender if it's normal that the staff drinks on the job he responded "yes".  That's good to know? The atmosphere wasn't bad though, normal diverse crowd, but the wait staff brings the place down.  Motto of this bar should be  Good luck to the owners!

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: Shots of tequila are generally always a bad idea.  Thank goodness for Henny.  That sugar makes the medicine go down...  Quick service... 20-something crowd (why AM I HERE, AGAIN?)....dark...lots of teles (can always catch some Texas game...).  This place is A - IGHT.

IgSg9e9D_NLsqTI_bRlu4w.review_text: Great Bar. Great Space. Tons of seating (booths, tables). Tons of standing room. TV's to watch any sports event. Lots of locals for people watching. Pool Table at the back.  Note*  Dont be fooled if I ask to get in on a game of pool...Filipinos have a natural gene to hustle in a game of billiards =)...many have be deceived.

4Yb-KSVU2o1Ui9DWU6Qe6w.review_text: this place is frekain awesome!!! I gotta say they have freakin' great specials on Saturdays (for college football, and continue onto the night)  that, and i don't know if its a "TEXAS bar" but i was there for the UT v. T-Tech game ... yeah the one where they lost in the last second, and the safety jumped the route... yada, yada, yada....   anyway, it was pretty dead at the time, but in the evenings, it gets pretty busy.  decent TV's, i think they have ~5, and one was set to pig-hunting (interestingly enough)  overall, i love this place because its a good balance between a place where i can go and chill and watch the game, but also can go and stay out all night there too!

QCAJ7bRsCq40mQtdQeRiYQ.review_text: McTeagues lies directly in the path of least resistance from the bus stop to my doorstep which makes this is a very dangerous situation.  It's a great place to stop and have a couple (half-dozen) Anchor's to fortify my body for the long (3 block), cold, walk home.  The bartenders are friendly (Amber is great), the beer is always cold and cheap, and the games are always playing.  Good group of regulars and welcoming to anyone that walks in.  If you are down on Polk Street, stop in and say hello.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: if you wanna brodown it doesn't get better than mcteagues. unfortunately the aforementioned broing down doesn't really do it for me any more. It's pretty crowded there too despite it's cavernous size.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: i was surprised at the size of mcteague's saloon.  in the back was a room with ample standing/walking space. tables were rather abundant on this friday eve and the drinks were moderately priced.  in all, a stable bar on the polk walk.

oBD4Fpy0JilKt4ItsNGoJQ.review_text: i fuckin love this place!!  great beer selection! great crowd and vibe! great for watching games or after work and not too crowded great if you want a lively semi crowded bar on weekend nights Bartenders are amazing and very generous the jukebox is phenomenal  go here and you may run into me

XJhmTEAJuYRgIP4b9wMcTw.review_text: The perfect place to sit with friends in dark booths and sip english-style warm beer.

K3lVb91XR9OtNFzs-0YZ7A.review_text: Finally found a legit sports bar in San Francisco!  I randomly stumbled into this place on a Saturday afternoon because my boyfriend was looking for a sports bar to watch college football and McTeague's definitely delivered!  There are multiple HD-TV's and the bar tender was very accommodating and gladly changed the games on each TV based on what people wanted to see.   The reason this place is getting 5 stars is because of Jesus' BBQ! McTeague's offers donation-based BBQ prepared by Jesus (their chef) that is simply delicious! Be sure to tip to Jesus! He's the man!

qK5GQYyckJx_5tyqDtqrXw.review_text: My friends wanted to go bar hopping on a Friday night and we found a perfect bar for our first stop of the night! McTeague's! I have never been to this place before, since I am rarely on this part of the city so I didn't know what to expect!   Line was pretty long at 11 o'clock and we instantly thought we weren't gonna be able to get in! Lucky us the line moved fast and we were inside within twenty minutes!  It's pretty big inside! and the bar on the left was BUSY, but ordering drinks here was a breeze and $7 for a shot of Jameson?!?! Keep 'em comin!!!   Most of the bartenders were extremely nice and generous, except for one girl who had an attitude towards a couple of my friends over a small misunderstanding about the drinks. I didn't get her name, but she was obviously giving my friends the stank eye from the other side of the bar. The bartenders in the back of the bar were nice and we got drinks there instead. We'd rather have our money and our tip go to people who deserve it :)  Overall, we liked this place! Huge bar area & there are plenty of tables on the other side. Music was also a mix of different genres to cater to the very mix and diverse crowd here! 4/5 for McTeague's!

X29mMOmgUQVv32PPUjxH2g.review_text: Fun bar with good staff. The 2 buck lonestar and country music on Thursday draws a nice crowd.  Not bad for sports on the weekend.  I agree its one of the last douche free zones on Polk.

s6FyY9I1l6TA01YD5ruvOw.review_text: Great bar.  The only issue I had was with a bouncer, but the owner himself took care of the situation in a way that not only made me feel good about coming back, but seemed to make the bouncer less antagonistic towards me.  I really appreciated that.  I know it can be tough being a bouncer, but I also know that a patron should be treated with respect.  The owner took both into account and I will definitely spend more time and money there in the future.  Bartenders are cool too.

5iCzdzUFqbwwjgYkfr2nhA.review_text: I think this place looks like a nice place to hang out. Was over here on Saturday night and it was pretty crowded. So this spot seems to on it.  The only thing I wish it had was some good music, I didnt really notice any songs in the background since it was so crowded.  Its like Elbo Room crowded and its a bigger bar.  The drinks flow well here and get to you pretty fast, which definitely is a plus since this place is pretty crowded.  Good crowd of folks. Good place to start the night and then roll over Vertigo to get your groove on if thats on your list of To-Do's for the evening.  One thing I just learned is their Happy Hour's are super long and have pretty good prices.

2zEWg50Mq95heTYtFiuMog.review_text: Now one of my favorite hangouts on Polk south of California. Great selection of whiskies and bourbons. Get the Bulleit Bourbon!    Came here before a concert at the Regency (which sucks as a venue by the way). Looking forward to returning for happy hour!

mW8fvDQ3JAtzeLjU--CjTg.review_text: There are....a lot of guys here. Yes, as others have said, total sausage fest. For the good part of the time my friend and I were there, we were the only females besides the bartenders.   Speaking of the bartenders....they kind of ignored customers and talked with each other while customers were waiting. Um, excuse me? At first we thought it was because they wanted to take care of the male customers first....but, nope....just stood there talking to each other.   Pretty standard prices for SF bars, $6 for Guiness on tap. Not too bad, but not sure I was thrilled about the atmosphere. May come back again some time, but we'll see.   Oh, interesting decorations though. I especially liked the Janis Joplin iconography.

E6TsVZLsLTSNx-6TmFQD8g.review_text: I've been in there now twice, 2 afternoons in a row. I'm really feeing this place. The bartender Amber is a sweetheart. I don't know what it's like at night but I'm gonna check it out. They serve food too but I haven't had any yet.  Oh yeah, and Happy Hour is 12 to 7pm so my beers were $3 each.  And I love the yellow lab who I think belongs to the owner. He seems to live there( the dog) and always comes up to say hi and get a pet.  Very spacious and comfortable. The jukebox is pretty good; Merle Haggard, Hank II & III, Pogues...

kn_-P3qG5rRAJeC4CqKveQ.review_text: Ah no......definitely not.  Stopped in at Mc Teague's Saloon at about 3:30 this afternoon, with a friend who needed to talk.  I spent a LOT of time listening.  Anyway, we sat at the far end of the bar, near the door, and the bartender finally got around to us maybe fifteen minutes later.  There was a small group of  about 10 people  circled in one space at the bar, seemingly watching one TV.  Other than that there were only two other patrons.  We were there for at least an hour, and the bartender never approached us again.  Even when he gave the check to people very close to us, he never even looked our way.  I was really hoping for another drink; it would have made the one sided conversation much more bearable.  When I got frustrated enough to leave, the bartender was at the opposite end of the bar, watching TV. Who hires these people?!?

5CXsfrWWqbcUwY8XkyCEHw.review_text: I love love love this bar! it has such a fun environment and the drink prices are very reasonable.   The only thing is it gets super packed so you should get there early!  but they have an extra bar in the back so thats pretty convenient.  cash only so stop at an ATM!

P9Y602xjKtSXwU72EwrMGA.review_text: Ahh what can I say, this is my secondary local only because I don't live near by. But its my first & usually only stop when I hit Polk street. I watch the World cup here & the atmosphere was awesome.  Very friendly bar staff who know there stuff. This is a true bar in all sense of the word.  It may look & feel like an Irish bar from the outside but subtle hints let you know its more southern, with Irish flair.  I notice the Texas longhorns are floating about the joint, but I won't hold that against them. Go Tide!!!

EKo9hm9BApdKiHut3QIabw.review_text: Oh yeah. This is my ish on Polk. Why do I know? I come here almost every Saturday. Free for girls until 11:00PM and after there is a cover charge but I really don't know how much since I just get a stamp and come back later. Bartenders are awesome, and one of my favorites works here! :) Security is nice and they recognize you and your group if you come here as often as I do. One night we even skipped the line, but it could either be that (1) they remembered us, (2) we're girls, (3) we were already drunk, or (4) we were loud and annoying and they needed those people. Either way it was awesome. The crowd is great, it's a mixed younger generation crowd. Love the Polk area itself because you can barhop and it's the disneyland for 21 year olds. Around 11:00PM there is ALWAYS a line to get in and there's a good ratio of girls to guys (okay, maybe more guys to girls but I'm not complaining here, either). There's a bar area in the front with standing tables on the sides and a few booths, then a mini-dance floor in the back with a mini bar and a back area with booths. Okay for dancing, but I would suggest Vertigo for dancing instead. Overall, great location, great people, bartenders, bouncers and place. Woo!  GOOD: -Great staff, location, ratio, mix of people -Drinks -.....looking people. (C'mon let's be real you want to know)  BAD: -Nothing. I love this place. (Okay it's a little empty around 10:00PM but that is nothing to complain about)

1zxx_sECzAnmOwD4-ilZMg.review_text: I like this place.  They have shiner bock on tap, along with about 100 other beer options.  So, this will definitely be go to beer place.  The booths are nice, especially if you just want to meet up with a few friends and catch up.   I think this place really depends on when you go.  It gets really busy on weekends and can take forever to get a drink.  It's a little too popular with the early twenties trendy crowd slumming it on lower polk on the weekends for me.  But, early weekend nights and weeknights, it's a decent place to grab a beer.  I would even give it four stars for week day happy hours.    But, it's definitely not the place to go to meet people.  Everyone comes in groups and hangouts with their own group.  No one really chats it up at the bar or anywhere else.  Hence, why it's a great place to catch up with friends, but not so great if you want to get out and talk to people.  Overall, this place is a solid local bar with an amazing selection of beers (on tap and not).  The bartenders are friendly, but don't except anything more than a nod when it's busy (which is fair since they are so busy).  I wouldn't order any specialty drinks here.  This is a basic pub.  You order beer or gin and tonic or vodka soda.  You don't order anything more complicated, it won't be good. I'll go back, but only on certain times and certain days when I really just want to sit and have a beer.

17dx_x9W_7QBT-3oiQQEQQ.review_text: As I'm in here 3+ times/wk, I haven't a clue how this has not been reviewed...  Since I've lived in SF, some of my most memorable nights have happened here...bf asking me to move in, obama's inauguration, bumping into my first bf from FRANCE at the pool table (Wtf?), many a reunion of college friends...  Pool table, booths, huge bar, good barkeeps...McTeagues continues to deliver some of the best times to be had in this town

56fP-02ya5JdCcL--IpifA.review_text: Killed time here for about 3 hours.  A bit on the expensive side and they don't serve food (BOO!).  Staff was friendly and the beer was cold but it was pretty hot inside that joint.   A lot of seating with a middle aged mixed crowd.   Didn't really have much to complain about and I really liked how dark it was in the booths here.   Pool table and darts to boot.   Perfectly OK spot to kill some time.

GSMoNXIieAIYBxpQz4uZpw.review_text: I'm not knocking this place in any way- it was an adequate stop in our Friday night barhop. But nothing stood out as being special- no good music, no great drink specials, etc.  I realized I forgot my ID while in line and explained to the bouncer. (I'm clearly over 21 and the man I was with had his ID, and was too.) The bouncer was definitely curt about it, and I had to take a cab back to Hayes Valley to get my ID. (We were meeting my sis in law there)   They recognized me when I got back in line....for my trouble, they could've kicked me a free drink or something, but no. :/  I wouldn't return, honestly. Very loud, noisy, crowded, can't walk type of place.

r1npFsFHayAdfeQjeXFSvA.review_text: San Francisco Bars!  CLEANLINESS: 4/5 SERVICE: 4/5 DRINKS: N/A  Came here one night with a group of friends. This place was packed! The atmosphere was cool. I didn't expect much from the bars here in San Francisco, but this place was pretty cool. Although there were a lot of people, you can still breathe inside and it wasn't so hot either. They also have some table seating, which is nice.

ZeiM3Uspn6CUThUBt03JSw.review_text: It had booze. It had booths. It had an ATM. It had a lot of dead space. Im sorry... I cant say anything else remarkably good or bad about this place.  Totally non descript.  In fact this place was a bit of a drag...   (... thats a small hint for my next review...  ;-P )  [Bar #4, 9 pints down]

C4HLEix-tKi0eN8yneOj3w.review_text: The most comfortable spot on Polk to just pop in, relax, and feel welcome.

r61MFYKQXpiCG1qqv5ENpA.review_text: fun on football sundays. lame on weekend nights. i thought i walked into the rockit room or some shit.  take your sports hats and square toed leather shoes elsewhere. or wait. i just wont come back, save you the trouble.

0l_0KpelMBhHzflxt8PkqA.review_text: Nice place to get your pint on.  Guiness was going for $4 on my visit.  The place is huge by SF standards, which gets McTeague's the fourth star.  The stools at our table were a bit unsteady, which made me wonder if they'd witnessed their share of rows.  You know how we 1/4-Irish like to duke it out.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: yess i've been looking for a place that reminds me of pb bars in san diego!!  finally finally finally.  i went out polk st for the very first time over the weekend and this was our second stop.  i went with two of my friends and saw some friends inside...  one of my friends was in crutches and heels + we weren't wearing much because we had just left manor west = a lot of attention from random people...  but you know how girls are.  we didn't really want to talk to anyone else... so what did we do??  tried to convince anyone who talked to us that we were crazy...  by obsessively talking about fraiser... except it backfired because this one guy loved fraiser.  okay this is weird.  it was just a humorous night because we had this little game going on so i was laughing a lot.    more about mcteague's itself... no cover to get in.  there was a line, but it was pretty fast because people were coming in and out.  bouncer was nice and so were the bartenders.  they were fast -- yay!  there's $15 minimum on cards though :(  butttt my birthday is this weekend and i think i want to head over to polk for some day drinking (:  maybe start here.  or end here.  or just stay here.

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: Give me free things and I'm a fan. They had a free buffet! Also, Coors Light was only $2. The main reason I'm a fan, however, is that when a drunk dude got up to some douchebaggery, one of the employees approached him and told him to knock it off because he was bugging people. I can't think of a better place to watch the Superbowl.

rnRrNwrEwjDj0Ue_im5OJw.review_text: Any bar with a picture of Shane MacGowan on the ceiling is A-OK with me. Bartender and clientele were super friendly. Meant to stay for one drink but ended up staying for hours. Being from out of town, I though SF would be full of aging hippie douche-bags, but places like this helped correct my bias.

3oIlTsI7GpQ57CGMekknyA.review_text: A big, gold-painted molar hangs from the outside McTeague's sign and that should have been clue enough for this English major.  However, it's been a long while since I read McTeague by Frank Norris....  So, I've been by McTeague's Saloon many times but never popped in until a rude bartender at Route 66 caused me to look afield.  Bad news first:  Even an hour after opening, and allowing for the TL-redolent air circulating through, the saloon retains an unfortunate (but probably Gold Rush-authentic) spilled liquor and old mop water smell.  But that's the worst of it.  Good news:  The old-timey setting, generous seating, artwork (look up), good range of bar selections, and a courteous bartender willing to mix up a drink as requested left me with a favorable impression (even if it is yet another big sports bar).

55lCIgnXN3qRxgSRxjcxpg.review_text: I love McTeague's!  How much?  Yesterday I drunk texted my friend and thanked him for introducing me to the bar.  I don't think I've ever done that before in my life.  He was extremely confused and asked how drunk I was.  Thursday Night: Pretty empty.  They closed off the back room due to the lack of patrons.  Plenty of available booths/ seating to the side.  No cover.  Friday Night: So crowded there's barely room to walk.  Is this seriously the same bar?  I don't think I've ever been to a bar THIS crowded.  Still no cover!  Back room is open and there's apparently even a place where the floor lights up in multi-colored blocks.  FRIDAY WINS!  (Play Rebecca Black song "Friday" here.  And down that jager bomb like a champ.)

sDjLntGYVuhp4FlKz33P_w.review_text: My friends and I stumbled upon this place walking along Polk. It was late afternoon on a Saturday and we wanted somewhere to hang out before dinner. First impression: they made strong, cheap drinks! I had a cranberry vodka and a Long Island while my friends enjoyed a few draft beers. Our bill for six drinks came out to about $30. A budget-friendly bar!  The bar had a good vibe, too. Crowd was mixed and everyone was pretty chill. I liked the "old San Francisco" feel with the decor.

IvVwnSl85RzTOEi9XmGSyg.review_text: Wife and I went here last night (Thursday) to check out their country theme night. We just moved to the Bay Area from Texas and thus were thirsty for Texas bear and country music. McTeague's definitely helped quench our thirst on both accounts! As for music, they were playing all the good classics as well as some good newer stuff.  Drinks were cheap and delicious! We enjoyed a few $3 Shiner Bock drafts and $2 Lone Star longnecks. They also have tacos and/or hot dogs for sale, depending on the night. Hard to find deals this good anywhere in the city!  We also met one of the owners (Chris was his name, I believe) who was super nice and generously offered us a drink on the house. We had fun chatting with him, and are happy to recommend his establishment!

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: Forgot to Yelp this spot. Went here the other night and just really didn't get what the hype is about. Maybe it was an off night...The scene was very odd. The drinks weren't great. Don't see going back anytime soon!

SLGg3GyUFQou_V63dlG6Mg.review_text: Be careful- two of my friends have had their iPhones pick-pocketed here on different nights. According to other reviews, it's happened quite a few times before. Security suggests you "wear your purse in front of you". I won't be going back.

opPpHVIp8SKHMJg3_y5Lew.review_text: I was surprised walking in this establishment that there were empty seats at the bar. I was further surprised that the micro-brew that I ordered was only $4 and so where many others too.  What's going on here? I don't think it was happy hour or anything. If so, $4 is still a pretty awesome price for a pint of beer in SF.  And I like the ambiance here too. Kinda looks like an old cabin with an electronic jukebox and a pool table in the back. So you can definitely tell that it as a "saloon" feel to it too.  Maybe I came in on an off-night for these guys, but I like the not-so-busy-feeling here, so I can see myself coming back to this bar again.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: I love to check out a new bar in my favorite neighborhood.  I went on a Monday night so the place was pretty empty (just how I like it).  Great decor, plenty of room and a great atmosphere.  My roommate tells me a pint of Stella was $4 so that's about right for the area.  It's nice to have a new place to swing by when on Polk.

xRJyMR1_QPuZuUhUuVaooQ.review_text: Stepping into this bar felt like I was traveling back in time to a frat party.  The place was packed and I was served beer in a plastic cup.  That may have had something to do with a 49ers game, but I suspect not.  This is not a place to kick back for a casual conversation but rather to get loaded and eventually have someone in your group puke and be escorted out.  I'm sure that's the MO of a lot of folks there.  This would be a stop on a bar crawl but not a final destination.  (Maybe I am just getting too old for this scene.)

0QdwQLVxZpgy9Qb2Qakflw.review_text: Great locals bar, with friendly owners, who occasionally will do a shot with out-of-towners that actually get the McTeague's reference...I think we found our new home away from home.  Lissa G and I popped in one afternoon to McTeague's Saloon solely based on the name since my wife is an English teacher book loving nerd, in a good way of course. The Saloon definitely felt like it had been there for a long time and had that old time feel, even though it has not been open very long. With gold teeth abound (McTeague reference - look it up) we settled in for a couple of drinks and pints of Guinness.   The owners stopped by for a chat and to give us some great spots to try for dinner that night. All and all, friendly folks and a spot that will make you feel right at home.

wUtx2M5OpyZvyBYm9Im7HQ.review_text: I went here one Friday night to meet up with two 'friends of a friend', and was ditched.  I wasn't devastated, because it was a pretty decent place.  They played Tom Petty on the Juke at one point.  This is still my first month in the City, and I don't have any real friends-- so going to a bar like this one solo is a little bit overwhelming.  In conclusion, I'll go back during a happy hour or on a Saturday morning...

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: I guess this has become one of my spots on standby.  I seem to find myself atop these stools fairly often.  There's a consistency in their service and pours that I can count on.  Plus, I've discovered why their Bloody Mary's are so darn good - they top them off with Guinness.  Awesome.

7IyZBsbOzUqkdulWTvieAg.review_text: This place is shady as hell but I guess their choice of music isn't half bad. Spent a drunk night here, too.

ahRGG_f9YI10ZdRHFi5C9Q.review_text: Watched the NFL Divisional Round Playoffs here and it was a great time. The bartender moved a table without us even asking. The place got crazy but the bartenders did a good job. I would suggest either pulling the barstools away from the bar to alleviate congestion or adding a few more bartenders. That S.F game was pretty nutty.  I am dinging them a star however because of the food. It was quite possibly the worst food I have ever had. The chicken wings were by far the WORST wings I have ever had. They tasted like wings out of a microwave or something that Papa John's would deliver. I will definitely return on my next visit to SD but I will be sure to eat before going in.

GY-eEHZrDllDrar5-HfMbw.review_text: I gotta give this place a serious shout-out.  About as good as it gets in my book.  I haven't been on a Friday or Saturday night, but when my softball team strolls in on Monday nights, they ALWAYS hook it up and are some of the friendliest bartenders I've ever had the pleasure of buying a $2 or $3 LONE STAR from.  Yeah, that's right, Lone Star.  Get some.  As for the ambiance: good amount of TV's with sports on, cool artwork, and laid back pub atmosphere.

g7Hf2ogv4Ts6HWrR91xCNw.review_text: One word to describe McTeague's - WIDE. I know that is a really weird reason to like a bar, but it's just perfectly spacious without feeling "big." I never realized how narrow most bars in SF are until I came here. It's one of my favorite bars in the city. I just feel happy when I'm here and I like the gold molars on the ceiling.

XNxvLsdeVBhUgczdxRj8aw.review_text: I happen to like McTeague's. I'm not sure how (because it isn't exactly my usual style of bar) but it turned into my go-to spot. With that said, I was surprised by how much fun I had the first time I went, and the time after that, and the time after that, etc. In fact, I continually have a good time there. It may be that I hover in the back near the pool table, and feel genuine joy when someone finally picks a good song on the juke box. Or, it may be that if you are easy to please, this is the bar for you. Lots of good beer to choose from, and even if you have to wait a second, the bartenders are normally pretty nice and make up for it.  I also like that the mix of people here is generally different, and most people are willing to get a little chatty over a game of pool. It makes it feel fun, without the awkward one-pool-table-competitiveness-vibe overwhelming everything. This bar is hard to peg...you can't really pin down the crowd with a generic catch-all, but that makes it pretty easy for you to blend in and have a good time with the people you came with.

ouWoshALRZLvd663BGvKpg.review_text: Good tap selection, friendly bartender. Can't complain. They have a pool table, along with a ton of cues, in the back if you're feeling up for a social game. The crowd here was pretty friendly, although it wasn't very full on a Sunday night.

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Came here to get turnt up on Saturday night and did just that.  The bar is pretty big, but its packed fast.  The crowd is somewhat diverse.  Actually I would say it is a good cross section of the SF demographic, pretty much a little bit of everything, where as some of the other bars on Polk skew one way or the other.    Drinks are decently priced and they take card to it makes things easier.  Once you get your drink and find a spot, you can start partaking in the drunken fun which may or may not include drunken dancing and singing (as room permits).  I am pretty sure the music comes from somebody's ipod or computer since there is absolutely no mixing or focus on any particular genre...Top 40 though out the decades we have lived?  No cover and relaxed atmosphere works for me!

tRyZ7RnmHi6rKFO0hRXZ6g.review_text: This place is crowded as hell on the weekend. The bartenders, Curtis in particular... gods. All of them. The place was just remodeled in the back and looks FANTASTIC!   Big selection of beers, tons of hard liquor, good prices, awesome music. What more could you ask for!?

Dw6yia0s2PgLOzaFTBNGwA.review_text: Wow, has this place gotten popular! Lately the lines outside are just insane. My friends and I decided to go last Saturday night after a dinner and we had not been in months. It has a good ratio of men: women, only I saw way more women this time. As you walk in, it looks like your typical saloon, no you will not see fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, gold prospectors, miners,  gamblers, or rango. You will see people actually pretty dressed up for this place.  It's always full to where you bump into everyone, and hard to get to the bar area to order a drink. There are booths on the sides and has the western feel to it. There is a separate room in the back with another bar and you have to walk though a mini hallway where guys usually stand against the wall like hawks to see all the women pass by or the occasional couple who I just want to tell them, Dear couple intensely making out in my way, get a room, tsk, tsk. If you look closely at in the back there are more hidden booths.   I always have a good time here, theres only a juke box, which is good, but if you want more upbeat it's not the place to go for dancing. The prices are reasonable, last time I bought my friend a beer and I had a vodka tonic and it came out to be $10. So we proceeded with shot, shots, shots, shots and started to speak in another language, loudly, and that's when we knew we had too many. The drinks here are a million times better than at Mayes next door and there is no cover.   I met the owner the other day and asked him why they do last call at 1:15am, and he says because it is too full and the cops pass by. Everyone was kicked out by 1:45am, uber lame. Rewind, 30 min before, there was this douche who had a champagne bottle and starting dancing champagne showers and got all of us soaked. Thank you big and scary bouncers for kicking him out, much appreciated!

Q-JUn8l86Opr2ZksuXlL3Q.review_text: I guess I finally crawled out from under my rock 'cause I made it over to this place and was shocked to find out it's been open for two months. So far, it meets all my criteria for  a bar.For a SF bar, it definitely surpasses them.  Friendly bartender- check Room to breathe- check  pool table, darts AND seating- check Beer Selection-  SO satisfying One inch puddle or less in the bathroom and no smell stronger than those encountered in my days as a public school janitor- CHECK  People watching- not as many freaks and geeks as I'd like but still enough to keep me somewhat entertained Hot men- oh yeah, we're still in SF. Forget this category.  Overall- stay away from Polk Street!, It sucks and you're way better off going to North Beach.  P.S. Probably should update this after a weekend visit. We'll call it test-retest validity. Research people!

JzmJ6U20uJ9pZonwKGvMuA.review_text: Times are tough out there folks.  Especially if you've moved out here from Texas and have yet to get used to the insane prices of the Bay Area.  Luckily the owners of McTeague's has a bailout for all the beer drinkers from Texas (and anyone else who wants cheap Texan beer).  $2 bottles of Lone Star all day every day.  That's right, no matter when you walk into this place you can get a $2 beer.  Want to spend more?  They also have Shiner Bock, and Shiner 100 on tap and Shiner black in bottles for a little more.  Cold Texas beer at cheap prices in a great bar in San Francisco?  Now that's some change I can believe in.

K_-HAJ0lnrRTIRFF73zLXQ.review_text: Love this place! Tons of space, good beer, big TVs, and awesome staff. Bartenders are cool and remembered me after one extremely busy football night. Owner is great (found my money in the bathroom and gave it back to me)! Can't complain about this place.  Plus you can go anywhere on Polk to get food to go and bring in the bar.  Well not just on Polk but you get the idea.

XV7n6VwqpWMud0ioCPPCcw.review_text: As a 28 year old grown woman, it depresses me slightly that the majority of my Saturday nights end at this bar. I have not moved on from getting blind drunk and getting incomparably excited by the sound of listening to the backstreet boys.  This place is usually a good time, it depends on the crowd, how drunk you are, and if they oblige and play enough spice girls and backstreet boys.  Sometimes you have to wait a while to get served, which is entirely for the best in the long run because they pour strong drinks here. I go from basic drunk bitch to cerebral palsy from roughly half of a gin and tonic here. Also, as this place gets packed toward end of night, you can assume everyone else here is also on their last, drunken leg as well.  It's definitely a younger scene, which can make you feel as though you are:  a) a cougar   and/or  b) an old desperate ho.  There is also one more option:  c) get so blind drunk that age becomes irrelevant.   I often go for choice C before making out with a random 23 year old. It's pretty promising, good way to find future husbands, ladies.  Overall, it's a good place to end the night on Polk, always funny, always full of characters... Just need to find some more men here who are a bit further away from completing puberty.  Cheers mcteagues, see ya again this weekend.  PS girls:  8/10 times, you can definitely find hot British and Australian tourists here who are down to make out with you in public.

omrCjG2LidihfnMTDcdNng.review_text: Great place. Crowded and hard to get a beer at the bar. Drafts beers fo 4.50. Did I say hard to get a beer, how about damn near impossible to get a beer at the bar that is 4 deep. Order two when you go up, that will help your situation. As I'm standing at the bar, I heard one guy say to his friend there's a lot of meat heads in here. As I looked around he was right. I also noticed that the people here get pretty wasted compared to some of the other bars around town. I was surprised there were no fights outside at closing time, but I did see people not able to walk straight. Very hard to move around inside as it is very over crowded. Everyone seemed to be in good spirits and looked like they all knew each other. All in all, I had good time. Forgot to mention. Good 80's music was playing. That was a plus watching the drunks dancing. lol.

pU74M-HoZCNyjJhGiWMfGg.review_text: I like me some liquor.  Maybe a little too much.  But I still like me some liquor.  Do you like you some liquor?  Here's to our no-nonsense drinking spot.  The drinks here are stiff and definitely get the job done.  All the bartenders are highly experienced (at least the ones I've met) and that means if you treat them well they'll remember and return the favor.  This is a great place to come and watch sports, kick it with friends, play pool and have yourself some drinks.  And more drinks.  And then one last one before you hit the road [but not driving of course]  Its a really big place and usually has plenty of room.  If you come on a friday or saturday night it is definitely more crowded then usual but still has ample room.

tAeV5o9OI5chNSLioHLI9Q.review_text: OK bar. Divey kind of, that's got good service,reasonably priced drinks but always packed. Setup of the bar is a bit odd with the mini hallway and different rooms, and the dark booths on the side.

ZNtr8ZhZUTQBADUUGtt_eA.review_text: Solid 4 stars for McTeagues. The bartenders are always super quick to take drink orders, the bouncers aren't jerks, and the actual bar space is bigger than most of the Polk St bars. For these reasons McTeagues is definitely good enough to make it one of my go to bars!

S8MPO_P1QW0YjZsqyAIoLg.review_text: This is my new go-to spot on Polk St.  Fantastic location, great drinks, large venue, and reasonable prices.  A great place to stop in for a drink (or several) while you bar hop on Polk St.  On a separate note, these guys are very big on US Soccer and always have the games on.  They provide sound and tv screens during big games, and have a separate area in the back can be utilized if there are other games going on (Warriors, 49ers, etc.)  When Jesus is around to make food, definitely order something!  He makes delicious tacos and charges very affordable prices.  Great bar food to munch on while watching sports.

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: Got a beer here (before Iron Cupcake), they had a good selection. I liked the ambiance, very pub-ish and relaxed. There's a lot of premier-league flags up and the bartender was really attentive.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: When I went last night (Friday) it was too crowded and there the male:female ratio was pretty terrible, like 10:1. Maybe on a regular weekday, the place is spacious like lots of people are saying.  I liked the interior design and the random western props around the joint. I thought it was going to be more of an Irish pub but it seemed more western.  Polk street is kinda weak compared to other streets like Mission St.

ysCBsXWPB-LAiewVS3jZfQ.review_text: Part of the late night, bar hopping Polk experience starts and ends with McTeague's. Part Irish pub, part west coast "Saloon," it is a drinking sanctuary that accommodates all occasions and all crowds. Judging by the lines and how consistently packed it is nightly, it is by far one of the area's most popular bars.  Plenty on tap and drink specials for days, libations just never seem to end here. From the obligatory Guinness on tap to the Shiner Dark as well as cocktail deals, no one can or should go thirsty. I myself prefer a strong whiskey on the rocks, which they have plenty to choose from.  There is free pool, live music on occasion, and when in season, lots of sports playing on all the various TVs. It's a great place for Giants / 49er games and even better during MLS matchups. There is a small selection of pub food and even complimentary BBQ during weekend games.  When the crowds come and the ventilation suffers, that's when I'm out of here. Saturday nights around midnight can be a cluster of dbaggery, but then again, what place on Polk isn't inundated?

WTZ5fgiL3JMN3K7bxoICXQ.review_text: i like the saloon feeling of this place. seems like its been around forever and isn't trying too hard to be trendy. my favorite spot is the pool table area in the back because there's a lot more room to sit or stretch out and it's not too loud back there. the only drawback is that on weekends it can take forever to get the bartender's attention since it's always so packed in here. but once you do, it's worth it 'cause the beer is cheap and the company's good!

lH4djNgW4uVVk-gQdyAfsQ.review_text: The place has a pretty cool aesthetic but is way too loud. Also, their drinks are weak and overpriced. I don't mind a packed bar, but the acoustics of the place made the noise unbearable. What's more, the layout makes it really hard to maneuver when the place is full. In the main area they have a step up to a row of booths. They have a bannister along the step, 3 feet from the booths. If you sit down here, when its crowded, you will shortly have people standing immediately next to you doing an awkward butt shake at face level. Forget about trying to maneuver your way back to the bar, you have to navigate the shoulder-to-shoulder people and the bizarrely placed  and oddly long bannister. This place might be nice if you're looking for a drink on a Tuesday afternoon or something, but on Saturday night it's hell.

9SgshXJZ55qZwj2cDKBBJw.review_text: I've been here a couple times, mostly to watch Giants and 49ers games. It's pretty chill except on weekend nights it gets pretty packed. There are lots of TV's, you can bring outside food in if it isn't slammed.  They have a good amount of seating. Cool place to just hang out with some friends and get a beer.  **They do have a card minimum**

Za1grDmkLhT8I77974QjaA.review_text: Popular bar on Polk St. Its wild on the weekends, but during the day its pretty quiet, and has plenty of tv's to watch sports. Its a cool Irish bar with some Longhorn fans. However, It's a lot different at night on the weekends. The bar is packed on the weekends with twenty and thirty year olds that have not left their college days too far behind them. They are either working and would love nothing more than to spend their money on alcohol or they are unemployed and would love nothing more than alcohol. The lines can get a little long here, but its usually not too bad. There tables in the front, booths in the back, and some drink tables in the middle. No cover. Drink prices are average.  On another note, I came here once with my good friend, the black out queen. She has somewhat recently retired that crown, but she occasionally shows glimpses of her glory days. Today was one of those days and we could not be happier. At some point during the night she decided that paying for alcohol at a bar just doesn't really make sense. So, she got herself a beer glass, reached over the bar, and poured herself a glass from the tap. We paused...looked at her...and rejoiced in sweet, sweet victory. Somehow, she skated by on that one and I've never had a more satisfying beer. And I think at this point, my black out friend believed this was how bars worked now. So, she casually went back for more and she should not have. The bartender went off on her. We stood huddled together like little school children being scolded. Our eyes scanned the floor as if we were going to find our lost dignity down there. But, we didn't get kicked out. So, another plus because of cool bartenders!  Another bar that my black out friend did not get kicked out of.

gqHPPdRBcDJyExcM0cwUWg.review_text: They insulted my Mexican hombre at the bar for ten minutes, all he was trying to do was get a drink...   they were yelling at him and telling him that we weren't welcome because of the language difference... All he did was stand at the bar for half an hour, patiently trying to get service....  Im not returning, ever. I appreciate diversity.

Hf9Di_yrDemWkQYvPAZglg.review_text: Went here for a friend's birthday in January only to return in March for my own.   I called on Wednesday to reserve two booths for the upcoming Saturday night and the woman on the phone said she'd get the info to the boss but doesn't see it as a problem. Said she'd get him to call and verify with me. Thursday rolled around and I didn't get a call and totally forgot. Friday morning I called back to make sure I'll have the booths - I was expecting about 12 people and figured most would like somewhere to sit. Same woman on the phone, remembered me, said the boss "hasn't come back yet" but still didn't think it'd be a problem. Ok fine, no biggie.   Saturday night! Dinner at 21st Amendment then on to McTeague's. It's my birthday, I'm ready for some birthday drinkie and good times with friends. Part of my group and I walk in around 9p (the time we reserved the booths for) and I notice every booth have people sitting in 'em. Two booths were reserved for someone else. Well this sucks. I let a bartender know whats up and he gets the boss-man. Boss comes up to me and is totally nice and understanding, I let him know of my phone calls.. etc. He gets us temporary seats and lets us know people he knows are in some of the booths and we'll get the booths when they leave ("they were planning to leave soon" he says) and then gets my friends and I a free round of drinks. He was very nice about it all and I have no qualms about it. By the time the rest of my group showed up we had at least one booth and tall table and a short time after that the second booth opened up.  Overall the experience was great. My friends who haven't been here before all enjoyed it and thought it was a pretty chill place. Will keep this place on my "the list" and return again!

f9aIofvRra79gzbPf5ui4g.review_text: this place is pretty fun besides the preponderance of guys.. but then again it is SF.   This place doesn't have cover... constantly crowded... just imagine a really really large and crowded dive bar where you have to push and pull in order to get anywhere... Drinks are cheap and if you come with a good group you can easily have an amazing time for a fair price here.

Exw_hvozx3VqwjXWgx63vA.review_text: Awesome place, its a lot of fun with a great crowd.

0O351e6z6HoHbSpCO9g91g.review_text: This is a great bar with great people working there. I walked in with my buddy having just been on the road for 5 hours, and got a great reception. The bartenders drank along side us, and really helped the mood out a lot.

9OXGWy6UWCxZFCAlezlg3A.review_text: You know you're on to something when it's a Monday night, close to midnight and the bar is almost packed.   Grab a cold one and be sure to look up at all of the "stuff" McTeague's has collected and threw up on the ceiling and walls. My personal favs are the casket tops with dead rock stars painted on them. Their smiling faces starring down on you as you drink your Guinness. Enjoy!

WFXkBm4SnrWd3uNFEEfQDw.review_text: I love this place! I've gone about three times and every single time was an experience to remember. Always good looking friendly people & great music.   This place is usually crowded since it's one of the few bars with no cover charge on Polk. Love it.

TcvCaYSlc94Ury0DK2R3WQ.review_text: To do it right: $17  Look! An Irish pub. Eight dollars for one Bushmill's?! Let's get Chinese food.  Summary: Regrettably, McTeague's is haiku-able.

kYBV4bJd4aoXqwpsVTpAGw.review_text: The Marina meets the Mission - younger crowd, but cool bar!

-Db9qbIoQ3X2-dqYu01oSg.review_text: rad neighborhood bar [on a weeknight]. this is the kind of place i want to bring a few homies [on a weeknight] and kick it in an atmosphere thats wide open, not too loud, plays the right music [our choice on a jukebox weeknights], has a pool table, serves a decent selection of good beers [in pitchers], and has a great special [$2 lonestar pints...all the time].  too bad i dont live nearby, or else id be a regular.

g0c-y7BAReLv0wMtT9JGzA.review_text: A great new bar to open on Polk street.  Came in here after a happy hour at R Bar and was quite pleased with the joint.  It has a midwest feel to it...bigger than your average SF bar.  There is also a renaissance feel to the decor.  Drinks seemed pretty reasonable.  The crowd seemed like potential for being a good crowd.    I'll be back I'm sure.

j-p3jYbVF_mWyOKNtloNEQ.review_text: 2 dollar lone stars!  Can't complain there. Bar has a cult texans following. Get ready for some football!

XGNn7SWgSgx0tqvKgRx1QQ.review_text: I'm a pretty big fan of this bar, there's plenty of seating/standing space, a good sized bar counter space to order drinks, a lively crowd on Friday and Saturday, good happy hour prices during the week, and great service from the bartenders. There's a pool table in the way back, but it's pretty much always in use so be prepared to beat someone first before you can play for friends. The crowd is young, in their 20s, and I've met someone from abroad every night I've gone, so it's pretty well cultured.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: It smells like poop by the doorway and I don't mean the outside.   Sloppy people watching galore

6R-DZXPyL5W2LiQoX9X8_w.review_text: Stopped in there this Saturday noon to grab a couple cheap brews based on reviews. Cool atmosphere but the bartender charged me $3 for a $2 Lone Star and looked at me weird when I didn't tip him due to the forementioned. I didn't bother sticking around for long after that.

H5EY1CeIx4m_pNChKZkq7A.review_text: I've never wrote about dive bars, so this would be my favorite one so far!   *Spacious*  *Happy Hour*  *Pool Table*  *Great way to celebrate*

n1BT4UjV0SMfMwCpkQwNLw.review_text: Nice atmosphere and friendly staff make mcteague's an all around good neighborhood bar. This is my bar of choice for sporting event viewings within the polk-post area.

xBcNPTcCigOS4We-4ZIHqw.review_text: I really liked the inside when I went here. A lot of space, eclectic decour. It had a very strange quality to it, especially with the big golden teeth. But the bartender was drunk and didn't seem to know how to make a drink. The service was just pretty poor. Maybe I'll give it another chance on a busier night. That's when it seems to thrive according to reviews, but my first impression wasn't a good one.

2UuNTFCDZPa3DImEA111fw.review_text: McTeague's would normally only get 3 stars out of me, but I do like what they've done with the space, which was empty for years before they moved in.  Right next door to the now-defunct Mayes/Midpoint bar debacle, I was skeptical of this place at first.  Because it opened up right after Mayes closed down, it appeared to be a feeble effort by the previous owners of Mayes to recoup the tons of $$ they had plowed into the failed venture.  But thankfully, it appears that McTeague's is here to stay.  It occupies a very welcome place in a string of bars on that stretch of Polk.  What McTeague's does right: it's nice and dark and inviting.   It doesn't try to be a typical Irish sports bar.  It's not too fancy, not too divey, the drink prices are not excessive.  It's fairly inviting inside, with a long bar on one side.  Bartenders have always been efficient and pleasant.  It could use more personality, but hopefully that will come in time.  Also, it would be nice if they were to start serving bar food, as well as think about hosting select local live music on certain nights.  Then I'd bump this place up a star.

2uM3O9Qy4vxvITAfke7_4g.review_text: Big, chill bar on Polk street.   I like Polk street, but I don't like crowds and douchebags. McTeagues is a great place to just hang out with nice and chill people. Bartenders are friendly & drinks are cheap.   You can watch football here (I mean the real football, where the players use their feet to advance the play, hence the name "football") even in the very early mornings as long as it's an EPL game or a World Cup/Euro Cup game (just make sure to double check prior to arriving here at 4am, as they do have their favorite and not-so-favorite teams, so sometimes they wouldn't want to open that early in the morning).   Yes, I like this place, I like the people and I like the drinks.

DrWFZ8H7UjtHvbhCTSQ7Wg.review_text: Wonderful place. Big size , nice people and music. I usually walk the place to its other end, I kept walking and there was always another area, dance floor, another area and finally some nice couches and tables towards the end. Will visit there more often.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: Awesome place! The bartenders are nice here. The girl bartender didn't charge me the minimum because I didn't know there was one for putting down a card. Dark and homey. Great neighborhood bar. There are TVs, and a pool table. Great happy hour deals. Dog friend too!

76y4aMBY0lT6zfJLy2EH-Q.review_text: I came to this pub hoping to find an atmosphere reflecting that of the book. The large tooth outside of the bar was promising, but inside, there were no distinguishing factors from the novel or movie.   The interior is spacious, and tastefully decorated as an Irish pub/ saloon. Disappointingly, they did not serve Anchor Steam beer, but they do have pitchers of beer for $12. While I was inside of McTeague's, I heard the bartender kick out two people for not having an ID, and that may be one of the reasons why the bar was so empty.

uEBYjEEGORtagp9bafj9mg.review_text: Regular pub with tacky stuff on the walls nothing too special about it.  It has nice booths.

yHfvvhPxEUrMZCHeklZEog.review_text: Spent last evening there, and  McTeagues was a great time. Rolled in at 10, played pool the whole nite, and left happy at 1:30. The drinks are reasonably priced, and they have good amount of bartenders working. Great mix of people in there every time I go. Good location that is convenient for people coming from other parts. Great neighborhood bar that does not feel too divey. Shot 'n' a beer!

ujHBDWF_jrv2mJ23-9bcew.review_text: Definitely a decent dive bar on Polk. STRONG drinks, cheap beers, dim lighting, and that smell of a bar we all love. A good place to watch games when other places are slammed too. I never decide to come here but also don't mind when friends suggest it.   They also have a cool set of paintings that show dead people standing above coffins on the ceiling such as Kurt Kobain, Jimmy Hendrix etc.. so look up next time you are there!

ma3r4D8KZ0Ksjpv-sU0QJw.review_text: I don't understand why some people like this place so much. Maybe because I've only gone here on super crowded Friday and Saturday nights. You literally can't move through the bar without brushing against someone. It gets so stuffy and gross.  However, it's not the worst bar ever. They play decent music, but no one ever dances haha. Probably because there really is no room to despite the large area. At least the drinks are cheap!

aJCjOAGLAsA4vJ26Mc99tg.review_text: I don't frequent many bars but Mcteague's may change this fact.  It's hard in a city like San Francisco who prides itself on having many fine establishments to find one bar that you want to go more than any others.  Bars are like shoes for me.  I have a lot of shoes for a guy, but I like to wear them all depending on how I feel.  Mctegaues just might be my new favorite pair of shoes.  The bar is long but wide.  It never feels too crowded but you can pack a ton of people in there. I went here twice two weekends ago, which never happens.  I had a great time both nights.  It's on Polk and Sutter so if you need a change of scene shoot over to R Bar and do some people watching.  If you feel like dancing hit up Vertigo.

Z2PISdtGHThSUUbFccGkrA.review_text: Always packed full of loud & obnoxious bros.  Stupid crowds. $10 Irish car bombs.

yRAuxeT7mKi7f3GGDX47tw.review_text: I went to college in Austin, TX.  How thrilled am I to walk into a bar that has $2 Lone Stars (during happy hour), and Tito's Vodka!!!!  WooHoo!  I had a great time on a lazy Monday afternoon, watching various games on the TV's and chatting with my friend.  Not sure if it becomes the kind of frat house bar that I stayed away from on 6th St. in Austin on a Sat night... but I am willing to give it a try.  The place was clean and staff was friendly. No complaints really.  Thanks UT Alumni!

l20MTXXZq6ydgig4cPBK3A.review_text: You came here with someone? What a shame.   Everyone here seems to have their eyes on the crowd, or at least that is the case this Hallows eve. There is something about costumes that makes the male species bolder....but not brighter.   I had a string of awesome conversations here. And by awesome I mean awkward, creepy, and a little perverted.   One gentlemen told me and my cheerfully-buzzed gal pal that he's with child....going into a detailed account of how he was given a uterus and has been artificially inseminated. I vaguely recall this being the plot of a bad 90's comedy...  The next gentlemen tried his hand with an insult, telling us over the loud music, "You girls look like perverts!!" Oh, really? His friend then told us that we should stroke his balls. No, thanks.   Then there was a very sweet man with a Pirate costume on, oh no that's not a costume? My bad. He told my (now beyond buzzed) pal that he once dressed up as a woman in college and was appalled by the way that men treated him in bars, and that he now has an increased respect for women. To you pirate lady-man: try bein' a lady in this bar!  Maybe its the throngs of has-been greeks who need to get their fix of the drunken antics among the 20 something crowd, or the girls who like to be fondled by strange men who gaze into your eyes as they walk through the crowd. To each his own!   McTeague's gets 4 stars for entertainment on Halloween, but my college days were well lived, and I don't think this is the bar for me.

iI5hC_uNUBGkkvtWrBIaZQ.review_text: Nothing like some cheap busch on Polk Street!  The first few times I went here I didn't think the place was that special.  The only selling point for me were the $2 Busch cans.  The place was too crowded with balding white guys for me.  Then, reading other reviews, I found out that this place is owned by Irish-Texans.  The decor came to life for me.  I understood the randomness of the pub decor and saddles.  Also the tribute to the fallen angels of our time above the bar (R.I.P. Kurt, Hunter, Rick, Janis...) is something that no other bar has.  To seal the deal on my continued business to this establishment, I had to try the raved about happy hour.  They serve $3 pints and $11 pitchers of... not Coors... not Busch... rather Stella, Shiner Bock, Anchor Steam and everything quality you can name from noon-7pm.  And it just happened to be during the BCS National Championship where they serve FREE bbq during halftime (for all college games)!!!  If there is a must-see game on TV, I would highly recommend dropping by during happy hour and watching the game on the array of flat screens.

RZUGrWB5EiNwaXHi6ZH7fw.review_text: My new favorite spot in the city. I was walking around Polk looking for a bar to kill some time before a show across the street when I spot a sign for Happy Hour that boasts $2 Lonestar beers. Cha-ching!. Love Lonestar and really miss Texas a lot so this was a win win!  Walk inside, dark enough but not dingy. Big Texas Longhorns flag on the ceiling. Paintings of Kurt Cobain and Hunter S. Thompson and Racer 5 on tap. Boondock saints and sports on the big screen tv's.  If you're a man and you're reading this and not drooling all over yourself. I'd be willing to question you're sense of manliness!

r5rFnOP5GLzGFM4PxYsnuw.review_text: The Blonde Woman Bartender rocks, I ordered close to 10 different drinks for my group and she got them all right.   While I will return to this bar, there are a few qualifiers...mainly that I won't go back on a holiday/mass drinking day for the public. Some of our drinks got spilled by an employee who didn't appologise or assist in cleaning.    When I called to complain the next day I spoke with Chris, he was very kind, appologetic and offered to refund my money...I don't need my money refunded, just an appology.

smunUn7in-kCoy2wHVbEyQ.review_text: okay i am not gonna lie. the first few times i came here i walked away a little confused. for example they have my favorite vodka (jean marc xo) but would always charge me a different price for it (ranging from 5-12 bucks). and no. i always order it the same way. rocks lemon twist. so its not like they charge more for rocks vs mixed drinks or whatever you were thinking.  however, being a main stay for a lot of my friends (the bar that is) i have had to venture to this establishment quite often. it has grown on me (see the four star rating). lots of space, not crazily loud, usually some rather fine ladies (and dudes, e.g., myself and my friends).  i have grown to like mcteagues. you should check it out.  oh yea. they finally started being consistent with their jean marc xo prices: $8.

Pf7FI0OukC_CEcCz0ZxoUw.review_text: I saw a lot of McCrunk things happen in this place, but the Shiner Dark made it all ok.   This little Nob Hill bar is sort of a cross between a dive and a sports bar. They have a bunch of Texas beers on tap, which made a few of the Texans in our group more than happy. The dark environs made our fairly intoxicated group feel quite comfortable, and the interwebs-juke offered a bumpin' selection of songs, keeping the music-minded at bay.   Overall, it's a place I could definitely pop into again on a bar crawl. A McDrunken bar crawl.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: officially one of my favorite, if not my favorite, bar out there right now.

NMNauN3TXZapniWfQ6rYFw.review_text: Someone stole my phone here :( And the bouncers were very nonchalant about it.

NtllNRgTxVPTy4R2UKsblw.review_text: This is one of my go-to local bars.  It's roomy enough so that I don't ever feel like I'm trapped in a long hallway packed full of strangers.  Otherwise- its a bar.  Dark wood, plenty of beer.  No PBR, which I find a little strange, but I guess maybe at age 30 I should try to class it up a bit anyway.   The crowd is mostly locals (except for Irish holidays).

1w3brs6DYDuWbvSYFkzvPg.review_text: They need to fix their jukebox or something. If I hear the Ke$ha Tik-Tok song one more time, my head might explode. It played 3 times in 40 minutes on Friday night.   It's a Texas bar, so I can't hate too much. Any bar with Shiner on tap is A-ok by me :) I usually have fun when I go here, but usually like to start the night here rather than end it.

wD6HLdtlsmVhdW10eabzdQ.review_text: I went here Saturday night.  I generally don't go to bars this far from home (about a 10 minute cab ride) but the girls wanted to go.  Turned out to be awesome.  Somewhat packed but not like you're bumping elbows with people.  Lots of great Halloween costumes spotted as well.  Good drink specials, everybody had a great time, and the bar layout is great - it is wide enough that you can actually see across the room, talk to other people and easily get up to the bar.  Will go back again.

LIJyH-dZO7SERCOPjvRIGA.review_text: I don't know what it is about this place, but every time I come here, I always have a great time! The crowd is great, the drinks are strong and the security guy out front is the sweetest!   Only thing... Thursday is country night. What the F?! Are we in Texas? Are we in middle America?! Why is a fun SF bar having full on, line dancing, country night? My friend and I came in on this wonderful country night, had a drink, and came right out. Hopefully this only happened once...

KmqivnDXe3mVjBtp9ZxkOQ.review_text: used to go to molly mcgees and now i got to mcteagues. kinda of a fan of irish pubs. its a pretty big area and lots of tvs. great for watching hte giants limited to seating but oh well. i wish when the playoffs are on they would play the giants on more tvs...who really cares about other teams when the home town heros are kicking ass and taking names.

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: Really like the bar staff at McTeague's. They're very personable and chill. The juke box was a nice touch too-they even take your pics and display them for the night.

rJhLKrWpry8Z6huZS5NhpA.review_text: I think I found my future ex-wife here, thanks McTeague's!  Prices were a little ridiculous but the atmosphere was friendly, and I love me some atmosphere.

HKC-j6ShF_wUfB0q1BH5cw.review_text: Nice pub on Polk and Bush. It's called "Saloon" and that should give you a hint - Thursday's is Country Night! Love it or hate it - the rest of the week you'll find this bar to be a good mix of Irish pub, American sports bar, and your typical dive spot.   For the Country Nights they offer line dancing lessons (it's tough to follow even if you haven't had a drink yet!). It's a fun and mixed crowd and the drinks are good.  Check out the specials - $2 Longnecks on Thursdays.

CnCKidH84Cnc1m-O1Get3A.review_text: This place was great.  After a few hours of sightseeing, I needed to find a watering hole.  I decided to duck in here and see what was up with the opening ceremonies for the Olympics.  It was about 9pm when I went in and was pretty dead.  There were some people sitting around the bar and a few more sitting at some tables. My drink was alright, if you like a super strong pour.  For my first drink, it was more than I wanted, but I drank it anyway.  Not one to waste a drink, you know? Loved the high back booths that make you feel like you're the only ones there.  I can see those working out well for a date night because they're dark and kind of intimate.  Several tvs were mounted behind the bar, 3 for the Giants game and 3 for the opening ceremonies.  As an hour went by, the place started to fill up and by the time I left at midnight, it was packed.  Best thing about this place was the decor - eccentric is a good word.  There were all sorts of things hanging from the ceiling and on the walls.  If I were on Polk Street looking for a bar, I would definitely go here again. The bartenders were attentive and this is definitely the place to go to chill with friends.

WF9A2oRNIOntssNoeBqHsQ.review_text: I've been to McTeague's twice. Once for a night out with the girls and just recently for the USA's first World Cup game. This place is great. They had the American Outlaws there and hosted a bunch of people who emptied out a few of the beverages on tap.  The bartenders: Very witty. If you can't take sarcasm or aren't able to throw it right back...brace yourself if you decide to say something dumb. They keep the ball rolling and do a great job of getting beverages out quickly. & when they're out of something know what you want as a back up. They do a really good job of making sure you get something to drink!  The beverages: At night they made me a bullet Manhattan on the rocks & they made it mighty fine. At 9:00 in the morning I was served a delicious tequila sunrise. I will say it didn't feel right ordering a tequila sunrise there but I also didn't want to order an OJ. Pick your poison. Oh the noon time whiskey sour is delicious too! That's not a new drink. It's just a whiskey sour at 12:00. Still delicious.  The bar: Got prime seats at the end of the bar close to the door for the USA game. Also got prime seats at a booth in the evening. They've got great seating no matter what you're looking for. It's not overly decorated which is great because no one wants to be assaulted visually by cheap themed decor. I will say look up at the ceiling. They've got a few pieces of art work that's pretty cool & there may be a chance for you to get educated on premier league teams.  The grub: Bring your own. There is a bunch of places you can take out from and they encourage it too. But don't be a Dirty D and leave your junk all over the place. If you ask nicely the staff will dispose of it for you if you can't find a trash can yourself.   Note: It's a Saloon. Don't expect table service or to get a novelty "scorpion bowl" with a plethora of fruit. You'll upset the regulars and the bartenders. And no one will feel bad if they kick you out. Great place to grab a beer or some whiskey and watch the game.

d93kciSV-2QwVysB9XP5Mw.review_text: Owner is so hot hot hot hot hot I especially love his middle part and his flavor saver salt and pepper prematurly aged hair due to stress from his so stressful life...but he is at the wrong bar!!!!!

O7hVHYuHj3pqk79UYlJEGw.review_text: Two dollar Shiner Black + complimentary nacho bar + dog friendly = GOOD TIMES!  This place rules!

04SoaTyjEcoLvkvDsba3yw.review_text: They have Shiner on tap. And booths. I love the boooooooooooofs.

96V7hqaMncuzTCVThAvmGg.review_text: Watch out if you pay cash, especially if you have an accent. Went here with two of my foreign friends, one Aussie and a Brit. We each ordered 3 whiskeys with Coke chase.   I was charged $21 and then the next was charged $31. Upon complaint, he was given $10 back, and thanked me because he had no idea the price. Then my English mate went up for THE EXACT SAME ORDER an was also charged $31. I told him to count his change and after he complained, the MANAGER!!! who served him gave him $10 after a death stare competition.  Now, you tell me, what kind of legitimate bar makes the same mistake twice in a row, and admits so quickly that they were wrong??? I called him out on it, and was kicked out of the bar for backing my mates up. DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BAR. If you do go, pay with card or know the drink prices. Its a big scam and the manager Simon is a scrub who cheats customers.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: This is the space next to O Reilly's Holy Grail which has been empty forevers. It is now a spacious saloon with Shiner bock and good selection of whisky.  Woo!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: And not just for Monday Night Football either! They hook up the free BBQ during Sunday games as well! Forget just the 99%, this is a deal 100% of the population can get behind!

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Happy Hour from Noon - 7pm.  Really, do you need anything else?  Ok, here goes - McTeague's has a fantastic selection of beer that is priced at $3 a pint during happy hour or $11 for a pitcher. $11 for a pitcher of Shiner Black? Yes please!  The spacious bar also features a bunch of flat screens (they had the Champions League on Wednesday afternoon when we walked in) in addition to a pool table and a dart board in the back. This is definitely a great space to start an evening of hard drinking.   One star off because I had to teach the bartender how to make a martini. But really, McTeague's is all about beer. Wait, is it noon yet?

d4QmEBbG771a62wMqgfdsA.review_text: Ordered two blue moons on a Friday night, expecting to pay around $16,only to find out the beers were only 5 bucks each. I actually had to buy another friend of mine a drink to get to the $15minimum to use my credit card. It was a decent bar, nice tv's, good music, but the place was just too damn hot. We eventually left after just one drink cuz it was just too hot. Otherwise, a nice place to grab a beer and watch a game.

l36ud3agBxzBJ88zIeNVfA.review_text: The Tender-Nob..... a neighborhood torn between classy and trashy. McTeagues comfortably borders the two neighborhoods, bringing in a crowded collection of the best of both worlds. A salon with a strong personality, stiff drinks, and sweet deals. Here you'll find a  dark, wide bar full of classic rock and colorful characters. With $2 beers and $4 well drinks - you can sip in the lively atmosphere without blowing your budget. The bar is well staffed - drink wait is short and service is attentive. Giving your more time for you to enjoy the many flat screen TVs, pool table, or jammin juke box.   Next time your partying on Polk - make it over to McTeagues for a TenderNob treat!

94-jtuCbuehXUhmTdiQmFw.review_text: Went here once with a larger group and we managed to get a table near the front. Place was absolutely jammed, but we still had a good time. Chill staff across the board. Really don't know anything about it other than someone involved (assuming the owner) seems to love Texas and they serve cold beeahs. Check.

UnFlsPRFGVKv6yJU-AbDkw.review_text: We were sad to see O'Reilley's close down next door, but were happy to see McTeague's come into our neighborhood.  The staff there is great, it is never too crowded and there are a lot of places to sit, the drinks are decently priced, (especially during their long happy hour.)  If you are hungry, there are a ton of great little restaurants next door and across the street and you can bring your grub in to McTeagues.  We are big fans of getting hot fresh nachos across the street at El Super Burrito and bringing them in to munch on while drinking a PBR.

A-q5Rz4z7k6Kafos0Vx96w.review_text: Came here mid-week with a friend. She is from Texas, went to Texas and  loves Texas. This is the place to go if you need a Texas fix.   I have to say I was not a Texas fan until after I hung out at McTeague's. That place is the place to go if you are a Texas fan. I believe the owner went to Texas. Any the place is decked out in Texas gear, as well as items that make me think of the west. It is definitely the traditional kind of bar. It is definitely spacious and really cool.   The beer selection is pretty decent. I was happy they had blue moon on tap, and that seemed to suffice. Their prices are reasonable. There really wasn't a crowd there, but I hear it can get busy on the weekends. Definitely a place I would come back to, to catch a football game or a hockey game.

bQlvgGnjXmijI39_0SYZ3A.review_text: If you want to get everything that matters stolen, come to this bar.  My friends and I came here for a fun Saturday night - by the time I left, I had my phone and debit card stolen. When I asked to speak to the manager (AFTER I was escorted out because I was "too emotional") all the security outside could say was "he's inside and he can't help you."   I actually had $500 worth of things taken at this bar, and I heard three other girls outside who had the same complaint. Management took no responsibility and said it was a common occurrence every weekend - personally, there are much better bars to go to where this sort of thing doesn't happen.

P0vxvQ7l82MP08-y3-dKUw.review_text: Wife and I had a great experience this past Saturday.  We are in our forties so on the older side of the crowd but lots of fun people in the room.  The staff was over the top kind and very attentive.  We went to 4 other places in the area and all were OK but McTeague's was our absolute favorite and a big part of what we will remember from our trip to San Francisco

-PyXVs_ZAKmey7gsRhz-hg.review_text: Eeehhh.. I've been here about 3 times. And while the crowd is okay, the actual environment is pretty unbearable for me. Right when I walk in..all I smell is vomit. Excuse me? The first time I came was for a friend's bachelorette and we went bar hopping--I thought maybe someone did puke. Second time...was confused. Last night we got there at like 10p!! It STILL smelled awful! There's this sour smell right as you walk in, it wasn't even crowded last night. Makes me think this smell never goes away..  For somebody who has a sensitive nose, I can't deal. There must be other places that don't smell so disgusting upon entry. =/

YlfeeuhSa6gpQTuiZ2dwOg.review_text: They are liars and unprofessional. On Google claim to close at 2:00 am bit "mike" says they stop letting anyone in at 1:00am. Apparently you can only get in if you know the owner.

JrYhr_3WGFkhAcEGq-ggig.review_text: I like drinking in the afternoon, and I like literature.   McTeague's happy hour(s) begin at twelve noon.  "McTeague" is a novel about a beer drinking dentist whose office was on Polk Street.  I love that McTeague's Saloon has a big gold tooth hanging outside its door as a homage to the literary character, McTeague.

PbmtoKdQ_Td9Ez_WwlEZig.review_text: In a lot of parts of the United States, McTeague's would be the best bar in town.  Right?    They open early and have a great selection of European Matches, and they draw a knowledgeable crowd.  They have a big selection of Drafts, range of $7 Cocktails, and higher end Whiskey/Scotch offerings.  I love watching sports here, and they have a lot of TV's.  It's a big place, and it draws a diverse crowd.  It is really one of the better Sports Bars in SF, and if you are from out of town and want to watch Football (EPL, not NFL) in the AM, you can't miss here.  6:30am on the Weekends, if I'm not mistaken.  You should also check out their art - I have some photos posted.  I don't know a lot about the history, but I know it dates back to the olden days of the 1800's.  I can only imagine Polk Gulch at that point.  It's diverse and rough-and-tumble now, but to think of dirt streets and a whole continent between you and The East (and no airplanes)...  I think this place helps us retain some of our Old School Awesomeness.
