h6WJ7zmg58OwNOP9kqy2oQ.review_text: I really like this bar. Its got a great vibe, good jukebox, pool table and its nice and roomy. Probably one of my favorite bars in the city as of right now!

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: I came here on Friday night to buy my darling Phil a beer, and am glad to add it to my list of "Places on Polk."  Oh, I didn't make that list yet?  No matter, because I will.    This would be a great place to have some sort of I-spy game at it (done after consuming one of their many beers and doing some shots- at happy hour prices, of course).  I spied a skeleton, lots of pretty bottles, cozy booths, a pool table, good crowd, a nice bartender, an ATM, and...a few other things that I'm not going to reveal because it would ruin my chances of beating you next time we come here.  What I did NOT spy was a kitchen, despite the fact that they had food items on the menu.  When I heard a telltale "ding,"  I figured that must be it.    Not a bad place, and I believe they take plastic which is a bonus for me as I never carry around cash.  I heard some people had some trouble with the in/out door, but that tends to happen when people are drinking.  I will probably be back...someday.

mIP064w8UzeiArLqt7tBiA.review_text: I love the bar. The story behind the name is what gives this pub originality. Mcteague is a book written about A man on Polk street in the 1890s. Its a fun different kind of place.

tLj-1t4y56oijKrDn-cVOw.review_text: If your looking for a good bar for your Polk Street "Let's Get Drunk and Regret What We Did" Crawl between Red Devil Lounge and your final stop, Lush... McTeague's is the place to go.   It was 9PM when we rolled in - expecting to chill - there was about a trillion people there (really...a trillion)...no dancing really...just strictly standing room only drinking. Although, I did see some booths, all of them were filled up super early on for a Saturday night.  There seems to be some noticeable favoring there tho...I ordered the same drink as my friend...and, although I didn't mind AT ALL, there was like 5 times the vodka in mine than hers.  Juke Box was filled with oldies and goodies...no real top 40 madness which is nice and refreshing when you know just one block away you can get your top 40 groove on at Veritgo.   Also has darts and one pool table for the gamers in a separated room from the main area.

HvdgGKbv1OHmKBPKQm-xNg.review_text: I always skip over this place in favor of the Hemlock down the street, but since the Hemlock got rid of its pool table, the place just isn't the same. So we hopped on over here to shoot, and I was impressed. Aside from having a pool table, the bar itself is spacious and I love the open floor contrasted with the intimate booth seating.  Got a vodka cran and it was $5 and tasted like cranberry juice. Eek! I asked the bartender (a guy whose name I forget but who was rad regardless) if he could spruce it up a bit, which he did gladly. In fact, after a few more sips, I had to request more juice to even it out.   My friend left his glasses here on accident, and when we called, they found them and set them aside. What great people! I'm sold.

jShChcFSVXOIOhuXTNrRvg.review_text: This is a solid option on Polk street to get a drink with friends!  I happened to wander into this place with a friend recently, and decided to check it out.  It was fairly new, with nice tables, spacious floor, and good decor of inviting wood and wall hangings.  The most important part to me was the bartenders were friendly, the drinks fairly inexpensive (similar to most places on Polk, so not necessarily that special on that dimension), and the service was prompt.  It definitely seems like a good place to start off the night for a couple hours, although maybe not spend an entire night there.

en7bEkzUtMBcZBGrADW3Xg.review_text: I asked for a Jameson and coke. I got a shit ton of Jameson and a little coke. For 6 bucks. Instead of the usual 8. UHM I'm a happy girl.  The bartenders are fun. And funny. I love to flirt with them. I love their kick ass attitude. I love watching the cute scene boys play poool. And I love meeting people here.  I can easily stumble my way home. Plus.

zpb17M4OG4Agjn3dK32CEw.review_text: Correction:  I have been to McTeague's Saloon 4 times (Thanks Janney...you are a great editor!)  4. Ali's fabulous birthday (so fun Ali!)

8l58FCsSrkxxyyexhoU0WA.review_text: Great place to hang out.  McTeague's is a very spacious and open bar with a great pool table in the back.  The seating is always open at the bar or at the booths.  I live in North Beach and have gone to many a seedy bars just to try to play pool but I would definitely make my way to McTeague's instead.
